analyzed: de ltar zla ba'i rang bzhin gcig kyang sems can rnam pa tha dad pas sna tshogs su rnam pa tha dad par 'du shes so //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: 'jig rten du mngon par gshegs nas de la lha dang mi kha cig ni 'di snyam du /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di bdag 'ba' zhig gi mig snga na bzhugs so snyam sems so //

analyzed: sems can kha cig kyang 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi mig snga na snang ngo snyam sems so //
translated: Some sentient beings think, ‘The Tathāgata appears only in front of me.’

original: sems can 'on pa dang / lkugs pa kha cig ni /
analyzed: sems can 'on pa dang / lkugs pa kha cig ni /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang 'on nam lkugs snyam sems so //

analyzed: sems can skad rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun pa'ang so so na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi skad du gsung ngo snyam sems so //

original: so so nas bdag 'ba' zhig gi khyim du gshegs te /
analyzed: so so nas bdag 'ba' zhig gi khyim du gshegs te /

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gi mchod pa bzhes so snyam sems so //
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gi mchod pa bzhes so snyam sems so //

original: sems can la las ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshad med pa rgya chen por mthong ngo; ;la las ni sku rab tu chung ngur mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can la las ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshad med pa rgya chen por mthong ngo; ;la las ni sku rab tu chung ngur mthong ngo //

original: la las ni nyan thos kyi gzugs lta bur mthong ngo //
analyzed: la las ni nyan thos kyi gzugs lta bur mthong ngo //

analyzed: la las ni rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs lta bur mthong ngo //
translated: some see it in the form of a pratyekabuddha;

analyzed: slob pa la zhugs so snyam sems so //

original: sems can la la ni 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa bdag 'ba' zhig gi phyir 'jig rten du gshegs so snyam sems so //
analyzed: sems can la la ni 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa bdag 'ba' zhig gi phyir 'jig rten du gshegs so snyam sems so //
translated: Some sentient beings think, ‘The Tathāgata has come into this world for me alone.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa ni zla ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa ni zla ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: The true nature of the Tathāgata is like the moon.

original: chos kyi sku /
analyzed: chos kyi sku /
translated: The dharmakāya,

original: mi skye ba'i sku /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i sku /
translated: the unborn body,

original: thabs kyi sku ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi sku ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su sngon gyi las rnam pa tshad med pa gnas thams cad du skye ba bstan pa ni zla ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: are like the moon, which appears in all places in accordance with the world, displaying birth in all realms due to immeasurable previous karma.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is permanent, abiding, unchanging, and immutable.

original: rigs kyi bu; gzhan yang lha ma yin sgra gcan 'dzin lta bu lag pas zla ba bkab pa na 'jig rten pa dag ni zla ba shi'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; gzhan yang lha ma yin sgra gcan 'dzin lta bu lag pas zla ba bkab pa na 'jig rten pa dag ni zla ba shi'o zhes zer te /
translated: “Son of noble family, when the asura Rāhu covers the moon with his hand, worldly people say, ‘The moon has died.’

original: yang dag par na lha ma yin gyi rgyal pos zla ba bsad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag par na lha ma yin gyi rgyal pos zla ba bsad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In reality, the moon has not been killed by the king of the asuras.

original: snang ba bsgribs su zad do //
analyzed: snang ba bsgribs su zad do //
translated: It has simply been obscured.

original: zla ba rgyas pa la 'bri ba med kyi /
analyzed: zla ba rgyas pa la 'bri ba med kyi /

original: lag pas bsgribs pas mi snang bar zad do //
analyzed: lag pas bsgribs pas mi snang bar zad do //
translated: It is only because the hand obscures it that the moon does not appear.

original: phyir lag pa bskums na 'jig rten pa dag ni zla ba phyir skyes so zhes zer te /
analyzed: phyir lag pa bskums na 'jig rten pa dag ni zla ba phyir skyes so zhes zer te /
translated: When the hand is removed, worldly people say that the moon has reappeared.

original: zla ba 'di ni sdug bsngal yang myong ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zla ba 'di ni sdug bsngal yang myong ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the moon suffers.

original: gal te lha ma yin brgya stong snyed tshogs kyang zla ba la ni gnod pa byed mi nus so //
analyzed: gal te lha ma yin brgya stong snyed tshogs kyang zla ba la ni gnod pa byed mi nus so //
translated: Even if hundreds of thousands of asuras were to gather, they would not be able to harm the moon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like this.

original: sems can kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa la sdig pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa la sdig pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: Some sentient beings give rise to evil thoughts toward the Tathāgata.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku la khrag phyung ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / log sred kyi bar du byas pa bstan pa'ang phyi ma ma 'ongs @211a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku la khrag phyung ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / log sred kyi bar du byas pa bstan pa'ang phyi ma ma 'ongs @211a *//
translated: They draw blood from the Buddha’s body, commit the five heinous crimes, and even give rise to wrong views.

original: pa'i sems can dge 'dun dang / chos 'jig cing ma rung pa byed pa'i phyir bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: pa'i sems can dge 'dun dang / chos 'jig cing ma rung pa byed pa'i phyir bstan par zad kyi /
translated: But this is only a display for future sentient beings who will destroy the Saṅgha and the Dharma.

analyzed: gal te bdud tshad med brgya stong snyed tshogs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la khrag mi phyin to //
translated: Even if a hundred thousand Māras were to gather, they would not be able to draw blood from the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ni sha dang / khrag dang / chu ba dang / rtsa dang / rkang dang / rus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ni sha dang / khrag dang / chu ba dang / rtsa dang / rkang dang / rus pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par na 'khrug pa'am 'jig pa med de /

analyzed: sems can dag ni chos dang / dge 'dun 'jig pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'ang med par 'gyur ro snyam sems so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i rang bzhin ni 'gyur ba'am 'jig pa med de /

analyzed: lci ba ma yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can dag gdul ba'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bsten to //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: the Thus-Gone One is also like this.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyis ni /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshe rab tu thung ngo snyam sems te /

original: gal te khyad par zhig ma mchis na de bzhin gshegs pas gnas par bgyi ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi'ang ci'i slad du gsungs /
analyzed: gal te khyad par zhig ma mchis na de bzhin gshegs pas gnas par bgyi ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi'ang ci'i slad du gsungs /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar /
translated: as the Bhagavān has said,

analyzed: sems can gang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde rna khung du thos pas nyon mongs pa thams cad sel bar 'gyur na /
translated: if sentient beings who hear the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra in their ears will eliminate all afflictions,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i slad du sngar 'di skad du gang zag dag sngon sangs rgyas klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed la sems bskyed de /
translated: Why did the Tathāgata previously say, ‘Those who have aroused the mind of awakening for the buddhas who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in the past,

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thos kyang don shes par ma gyur to zhes gsungs so //
translated: even though they have heard the great nirvāṇa, they do not understand the meaning’?

original: gal te don mi 'tshal na nyon mongs pa thams cad ji ltar chod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te don mi 'tshal na nyon mongs pa thams cad ji ltar chod par 'gyur /
translated: If they do not understand the meaning, how can they sever all afflictions?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @215a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @215a *//
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: pa; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: pa; rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

analyzed: log sred can ma gtogs par sems can gzhan dag mdo sde 'di thos na thams cad kyi byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: except for those with wrong views, all other sentient beings who hear this sūtra will have a cause for awakening.

original: chos kyi sgra'i 'od zer ba spu'i bu gar zhugs na gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sgra'i 'od zer ba spu'i bu gar zhugs na gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the light rays of the sound of the Dharma enter their pores, they will undoubtedly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu gang zhig sangs rgyas tshad med pa snyed la bsnyen bkur ba dang / mchod pa dang / phyag byas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos te /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig sangs rgyas tshad med pa snyed la bsnyen bkur ba dang / mchod pa dang / phyag byas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos te /
translated: If a person serves, makes offerings, and pays homage to countless buddhas, he will hear the Mahayana sutras of the Great Nirvana.

original: bsod nams chung ngu rnams kyis thos par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams chung ngu rnams kyis thos par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Those of little merit will not be able to hear them.

original: de'ang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: gang yon tan chen po dang ldan pa dag ni don chen po 'di thos par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang yon tan chen po dang ldan pa dag ni don chen po 'di thos par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who possess great virtues will hear this great meaning.

original: zhan pa chung ngu rnams kyis thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhan pa chung ngu rnams kyis thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those of little virtue will not be able to hear it.

original: de la don chen po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi shin tu zab pa'i gsang ba'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
analyzed: de la don chen po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi shin tu zab pa'i gsang ba'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la bya ste /
translated: Here, the great meaning refers to the secret essence of the buddhas’ profound teachings, the buddha-nature.

original: de bas na don chen po zhes bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de bas na don chen po zhes bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: This is why it is called the great meaning.🔽The bodhisattva Kasyapa then said to the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One.

original: ji ltar na byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa dag byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa dag byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur zhes bgyi /
translated: How can those who have not given rise to the mind of awakening become a cause of awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Kāśyapa:

original: gang zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos nas 'di skad du bdag ni byang chub tu sems bskyed mi dgos so zhes dam pa'i chos la skur na mi de rmi lam na srin po'i @215b gzugs mthong ste shin tu skrag par yang
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos nas 'di skad du bdag ni byang chub tu sems bskyed mi dgos so zhes dam pa'i chos la skur na mi de rmi lam na srin po'i @215b gzugs mthong ste shin tu skrag par yang
translated: “If someone hears this Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra and says, ‘I do not need to give rise to the mind of awakening,’ and denigrates the true Dharma, that person will see the form of a rākṣasa in their dreams and be terrified.

original: 'gyur la / srin po de 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'gyur la / srin po de 'di skad du /
translated: The rākṣasa will say,

original: kye; rigs kyi bu khyod gal te byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na khyod kyi 'tsho ba'i srog gcad do zhes smras pas mi de skrag bzhin du sad nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kye; rigs kyi bu khyod gal te byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na khyod kyi 'tsho ba'i srog gcad do zhes smras pas mi de skrag bzhin du sad nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘Hey, son of noble family, if you do not give rise to the mind of awakening, I will cut off your life force.’ The person will wake up in fear and give rise to the mind of awakening.

original: skyes bu de tshe 'phos nas gal te ngan song gsum du lhung ngam /
analyzed: skyes bu de tshe 'phos nas gal te ngan song gsum du lhung ngam /
translated: If that person’s life ends and they fall into the three lower realms,

original: mi dang mtho ris kyi lhar skyes kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun mi chad de /
analyzed: mi dang mtho ris kyi lhar skyes kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun mi chad de /
translated: Even if one is born as a human or a celestial being, the stream of the thought of enlightenment is not cut off.

original: dran pas na gang zag de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pas na gang zag de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one remembers this, one should know that this person is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: don de lta bas na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i byin dang shugs kyis byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de lta bas na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i byin dang shugs kyis byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This being so, the power and force of the Great Nirvana is called the cause of enlightenment for those who have not generated the thought of enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a noble family!

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the cause and condition of the bodhisattva’s generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: rgyu dang rkyen med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not without cause and condition.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa 'di ni yang dag par sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa 'di ni yang dag par sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this sublime sūtra of the Great Vehicle was spoken by the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a noble family!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like this:

original: dper na / steng gi nam mkha' la char sprin gyis khebs te /
analyzed: dper na / steng gi nam mkha' la char sprin gyis khebs te /
translated: For example, if the sky above is covered with rain clouds

original: char pa chen po bab na shing skam mam /
analyzed: char pa chen po bab na shing skam mam /
translated: and a heavy rain falls, a dry tree

original: brag gam / ri mthon po chu mi phyin pa'i gnas thams cad du'ang 'bab ste /
analyzed: brag gam / ri mthon po chu mi phyin pa'i gnas thams cad du'ang 'bab ste /
translated: It flows into all places where there are cliffs and high mountains that are not reached by water.

original: shong bu dang / sa dma' ba kun tu chus yongs su gang la /
analyzed: shong bu dang / sa dma' ba kun tu chus yongs su gang la /
translated: It fills all the ravines and low-lying areas with water.

original: sems can tshad med pa thams cad la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa thams cad la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: It benefits all sentient beings without limit.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde'ang de dang 'dra ste /🔽chos chen po'i char sems can @216a *//
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde'ang de dang 'dra ste / chos chen po'i char sems can @216a *//
translated: The Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is also like this.

original: kun la phab kyang /
analyzed: kun la phab kyang /
translated: It rains the great Dharma on all sentient beings.

original: log sred can 'ba' zhig ni byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: log sred can 'ba' zhig ni byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: But only those with wrong views have no place for the sprout of the thought of awakening to grow.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / sa bon tshigs pa ni bskal pa brgya stong gi bar du char gyis yongs su brlan kyang myu gu mi skye ste /
analyzed: dper na / sa bon tshigs pa ni bskal pa brgya stong gi bar du char gyis yongs su brlan kyang myu gu mi skye ste /
translated: it is like a seed that is rotten. Even if it is moistened by rain for a hundred thousand eons, a sprout will not grow.

original: skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: It has no place to grow.

original: log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Those with wrong views are also like this.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa thos su zin kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi myu gu mi skye ste /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa thos su zin kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi myu gu mi skye ste /
translated: Even if they hear the sublime Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra, the sprout of the thought of awakening will not grow.

original: skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no place for him to be born.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang zag de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad med par byas te sa bon tshig pa dang 'dra bar gyur pas byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang myu gu mi skye'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad med par byas te sa bon tshig pa dang 'dra bar gyur pas byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang myu gu mi skye'o //
translated: Because that person has destroyed all his roots of virtue, and is like a burnt seed. The roots of enlightenment and the sprouts of enlightenment will not grow.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is also like this:

analyzed: dper na / nor bu rin po che chu 'dang lta bu chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du bcug na nor bu'i mthus chu dang bar 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: 'jim pa'i nang du bcug na dang bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The excellent sutra of the Great Nirvana is also like this.

analyzed: sems can mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / phas pham pa bzhi byung ba'i chu rnyog ma can lta bu'i nang du bcug na dag par 'gyur zhing /

original: byang chub tu sems skye'ang srid kyi /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems skye'ang srid kyi /
translated: and it is even possible that the mind of enlightenment will arise.

original: log sred can 'jim rdzab lta bu'i nang du ni lo brgya stong gi bar du bzhag kyang dag par 'gyur zhe'am /
analyzed: log sred can 'jim rdzab lta bu'i nang du ni lo brgya stong gi bar du bzhag kyang dag par 'gyur zhe'am /
translated: Even if you were to leave a person with perverted desires in a pit of filth for a hundred thousand years, he would not become pure.

original: byang chub kyi sems skye mi srid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems skye mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for him to give rise to the thought of enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

analyzed: log sred can ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun med par byas pas snod du ma gyur to //
translated: Because a person with perverted desires has destroyed all his roots of virtue and is therefore unfit.

analyzed: de la gal te gang zag des lo brgya @216b stong gi bar du mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde 'di mnyan tam /

original: 'dzin kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dzin kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed mi nus so //
translated: he would still be unable to give rise to the thought of enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge ba'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has no virtuous mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste / dper na / sman gyi sdong po'i nang na sman gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba ni sman gyi nang na mchog dang phul du gyur pas dar ba dang sbyar ram /
translated: it is also like this.

analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ram / mar dang sbyar ram /

original: chu dang bsres sam /
analyzed: chu dang bsres sam /
translated: or milk.

original: 'o ma dang bsres sam /🔽phye mar btags sam /🔽ril bur byas sam /🔽lde gur bskus sam /
analyzed: 'o ma dang bsres sam / phye mar btags sam / ril bur byas sam / lde gur bskus sam /
translated: mixed with milk,🔽ground into a powder,🔽made into pills,

original: dris bdugs sam /
analyzed: dris bdugs sam /
translated: made into an ointment,🔽made into an incense,

original: mig tu bskus sam /
analyzed: mig tu bskus sam /
translated: put into the eyes,

analyzed: 'thung ngam / mnams pa tsam gyis kyang sems can gyi nad thams cad zhi bar byed de /
translated: or drunk, or even just smelled, it can cure all the illnesses of sentient beings.

original: 'on kyang sman gyi sdong po de 'di snyam du sems can dag bdag gi rtsa ba blangs na lo ma brda ba'i mi rigs snyam mam /🔽lo ma brdas na rtsa ba blang ba'i mi rigs snyam mam /🔽sdong po blangs na pags pa bshu ba'i mi rigs snyam mam /
analyzed: 'on kyang sman gyi sdong po de 'di snyam du sems can dag bdag gi rtsa ba blangs na lo ma brda ba'i mi rigs snyam mam / lo ma brdas na rtsa ba blang ba'i mi rigs snyam mam / sdong po blangs na pags pa bshu ba'i mi rigs snyam mam /
translated: However, the medicine tree does not think, ‘If sentient beings take my roots, it is not right to take my leaves.🔽If they take my leaves, it is not right to take my roots.🔽If they take my trunk, it is not right to peel my bark.

original: pags pa bshus na sdong po brnga ba'i mi rigs snyam mi sems te /
analyzed: pags pa bshus na sdong po brnga ba'i mi rigs snyam mi sems te /
translated: If they peel my bark, it is not right to cut my trunk.’

original: de ltar mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar mi sems mod kyi /
translated: It does not think in this way.

original: 'on kyang sems can gyi nad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel nus so //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can gyi nad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel nus so //
translated: Nevertheless, it is able to eliminate all the suffering and illness of sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: this sublime sūtra of the Great Nirvana is also like this.

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi phas pham pa bzhi  mtshams med pa lnga dang / phyi rol dang nang gi mi dge ba'i las thams cad med par byed de / gang byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa dag kyang 'di'i @217a *//
translated: It can eliminate all the four grave offenses and five heinous crimes of all sentient beings, as well as all their unwholesome actions, both external and internal.

original: dbang gis byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang gis byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who have not yet aroused the aspiration for enlightenment will, by its power, arouse the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mdo sde 'di'ang mdo sde thams cad kyi nang na rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'ang mdo sde thams cad kyi nang na rgyal po lta bu ste /

original: ji ltar sman gyi nang na sman gyi rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sman gyi nang na sman gyi rgyal po lta bu'o //

analyzed: gang zhig mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di la nan tan byed dam /

analyzed: nan tan mi byed kyang rung /
translated: whether or not they practice it,

analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i mtshan yod pa thos te /
translated: will hear the name of this sutra.

analyzed: thos ma thag tu dad cing yid ches na nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad med par byed kyang /

analyzed: log sred can dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bde bar dgod mi nus so //
translated: However, it cannot easily establish those of wrong views in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ji ltar sman gyi rgyal po de nad thams cad 'tsho bar byed mod kyi /

analyzed: nges par 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but cannot cure someone who is fated to die.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

original: dper na / lag pa la rma yong pa dag gis dug gzung na dug khong du 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na / lag pa la rma yong pa dag gis dug gzung na dug khong du 'gro'o //
translated: For example, if someone with a wound on their hand were to pick up poison, the poison would enter their body.

original: rma med pa ni gzung yang khong du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rma med pa ni gzung yang khong du mi 'gro'o //
translated: But if they have no wound, even if they pick it up, it will not enter their body.

original: log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true for those with wrong views.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu med pas rma med pas dug gzung ba dang mtshungs te khong du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu med pas rma med pas dug gzung ba dang mtshungs te khong du mi 'gro'o //
translated: Because they lack the cause for enlightenment, they are like those without a wound, and even if they pick up the poison, it will not enter them.

original: rma zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rma zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu'o //
translated: A wound is a cause for unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: dug ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i sman lta bu'o //
analyzed: dug ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i sman lta bu'o //
translated: Poison is like the medicine of ultimate truth.

original: rma med pa ni log sred can lta bu'o //
analyzed: rma med pa ni log sred can lta bu'o //
translated: Those without a wound are like those with wrong views.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

original: dper na / rdo rje ni cis kyang mi chog ste /
analyzed: dper na / rdo rje ni cis kyang mi chog ste /
translated: For example, a vajra cannot be destroyed by anything.

original: thams cad phigs shing gcog nus kyang rus spal gyi khog pa dang ra rus chogs so //
analyzed: thams cad phigs shing gcog nus kyang rus spal gyi khog pa dang ra rus chogs so //
translated: Although they can pierce and break everything, they cannot break the shell of a tortoise or the horn of a goat.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen @217b po'i mdo sde 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen @217b po'i mdo sde 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: This sutra of the Great Nirvana is also like this.

original: tshad med pa'i sems can byang chub kyi lam la bde bar btsud kyang log sred can dag ni byang chub kyi rgyu skyed mi nus so //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sems can byang chub kyi lam la bde bar btsud kyang log sred can dag ni byang chub kyi rgyu skyed mi nus so //
translated: Although it can lead countless sentient beings to the path of enlightenment, it cannot cause those of false views to generate the cause of enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is also like this.

original: rtsva dan thu li ka dang / shing sba li shi dang / li ka lta bu sdong bu dang / yal ga bcad kyang de ma thag de ma thag tu phyir skyes te /
analyzed: rtsva dan thu li ka dang / shing sba li shi dang / li ka lta bu sdong bu dang / yal ga bcad kyang de ma thag de ma thag tu phyir skyes te /
translated: The stems and branches of the dhanuska, balbaja, and li plants will grow back immediately if cut,

original: shing ta la ltar bcad nas phyir skye ba ni ma yin no; ;sems can de dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: shing ta la ltar bcad nas phyir skye ba ni ma yin no; ;sems can de dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: but they are not like the tala tree, which grows back after being cut. Sentient beings are also like this.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos na phas pham pa bzhi byung ngam /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos na phas pham pa bzhi byung ngam /
translated: If they hear this sutra of the Great Nirvana,

original: mtshams med pa lnga byas kyang byang chub kyi rgyu phyir skye'ang srid kyi /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byas kyang byang chub kyi rgyu phyir skye'ang srid kyi /
translated: Even if one has committed the five heinous crimes, it is still possible for him to generate the cause of enlightenment.

original: log sred can ni de ltar ma yin te /🔽mdo sde dam pa 'di thos sam /
analyzed: log sred can ni de ltar ma yin te / mdo sde dam pa 'di thos sam /
translated: But this is not so for those who have perverted desires.

original: mnyan kyang byang chub kyi rgyu skye mi srid do //
analyzed: mnyan kyang byang chub kyi rgyu skye mi srid do //
translated: Even if they hear or listen to this Sutra, it is impossible for them to generate the cause of enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Good son!

original: dper na / shing ta la dang / tsin do ka lta bu bcad na sa bon 'tshig pa dang 'dra ste phyir mi skye'o //
analyzed: dper na / shing ta la dang / tsin do ka lta bu bcad na sa bon 'tshig pa dang 'dra ste phyir mi skye'o //
translated: Again, it is like the tala and cinnamon trees which, once cut down, do not grow again.

original: log sred can dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: log sred can dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Those with perverted desires are also like this.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos kyang byang chub kyi rgyu mi skye ba ni sa bon tshig pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde thos kyang byang chub kyi rgyu mi skye ba ni sa bon tshig pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even if they hear the Mahayana Sutra, it is impossible for them to generate the cause of enlightenment, just as a burnt seed cannot grow.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Good son!

original: dper na / char chen po bab na nam mkha' stong pa la mi chags so //
analyzed: dper na / char chen po bab na nam mkha' stong pa la mi chags so //
translated: Again, it is like a great rain which does not remain in the empty sky.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde 'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde 'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Mahayana Sutra is also like this.

original: chos kyi char kun tu phab kyang log sred can la mi chags so //
analyzed: chos kyi char kun tu phab kyang log sred can la mi chags so //
translated: Although the rain of the Dharma falls everywhere, it does not adhere to those with perverse desires.

original: log sred can gyi lus la rdo rje gtams pa ltar kun tu khyab pas cis kyang mi tshugs so //
analyzed: log sred can gyi lus la rdo rje gtams pa ltar kun tu khyab pas cis kyang mi tshugs so //
translated: The body of those with perverse desires is filled with vajras, and so nothing can harm them.

original: @218a *// byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: @218a *// byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa addressed the Buddha, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa las kyang bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa las kyang bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha has also said in verse:

original: dge ba ma mthong dge mi byed //
analyzed: dge ba ma mthong dge mi byed //
translated: Not seeing virtue, one does not practice virtue.

original: sdig pa mthong bas sdig pa byed /
analyzed: sdig pa mthong bas sdig pa byed /

original: de la 'jigs shing byol ba ni //
analyzed: de la 'jigs shing byol ba ni //
translated: Frightened and avoiding it,

original: ji ltar lam ngan g-yangs bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar lam ngan g-yangs bzhin //
translated: It is like a bad road.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces gsungs pa'i don ji lta bu lags //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces gsungs pa'i don ji lta bu lags //
translated: What is the meaning of the Bhagavān’s saying this?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: ma mthong zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma mthong ba'o //
translated: “Not seeing” means not seeing the buddha-nature.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: “Virtue” means unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: mi byed ces bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi byed ces bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not doing means not serving and respecting the spiritual friend.

original: mthong zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing means seeing that there is no cause and effect.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la skur ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la skur ba'o //
translated: Sin means slandering the Vaipulya Mahayana sutras.

original: byed ces bya ba ni log sred can shin tu rgyas pa med par smra ba ste /
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni log sred can shin tu rgyas pa med par smra ba ste /

original: de bas na log sred can dag ni yongs su dag pa'i dge ba'i chos la 'jug cing 'bad pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: de bas na log sred can dag ni yongs su dag pa'i dge ba'i chos la 'jug cing 'bad pa'i sems med do //
translated: Therefore, the nihilists have no mind to enter into and strive for pure good dharmas.

original: chos gang la dge ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang la dge ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What dharma is called good?

original: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug cing 'bad pa ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug cing 'bad pa ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: Entering into and striving for nirvana is diligently practicing the noble conduct.

original: log sred can dag ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa mi spyod pas mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug cing 'bad mi nus so //
analyzed: log sred can dag ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa mi spyod pas mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug cing 'bad mi nus so //
translated: The nihilists, not practicing the noble conduct, are unable to enter into and strive for nirvana.

original: de la skrag par bya'o @218b zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos la skur ba ste /
analyzed: de la skrag par bya'o @218b zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos la skur ba ste /
translated: “One should be afraid of that” means to slander the holy Dharma.

original: gang gis skrag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis skrag par bya zhe na /
translated: “By whom should one be afraid?”

original: mkhas pa shes rab can dag gis so //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can dag gis so //
translated: “By the wise and the learned.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: chos la skur pas dge ba'i sems med do //
analyzed: chos la skur pas dge ba'i sems med do //
translated: “Because one who slanders the Dharma has no virtuous mind.

original: sbyor ba'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no method of practice.”

original: lam g-yang sa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: lam g-yang sa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: “The path is a precipice” refers to conditioned things.

original: 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
translated: Kāśyapa asked again:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las //
translated: “In the teachings of the Bhagavān,

original: bya ba mthong ba gang dag lags //
analyzed: bya ba mthong ba gang dag lags //
translated: what are the things to be seen?

original: dge ba'i chos su gang dag 'gyur //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos su gang dag 'gyur //
translated: What are the virtuous dharmas?

original: mi 'jigs pa yi gnas ni gang //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa yi gnas ni gang //
translated: What is the place of fearlessness?

original: rgyal pos bde ba'i lam bgrod bzhin //
analyzed: rgyal pos bde ba'i lam bgrod bzhin //
translated: Like a king traveling on a path of happiness,

original: zhes bgyi ba'i don ni ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba'i don ni ji lta bu lags /
translated: what is the meaning of that?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: bya ba mthong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba mthong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‘things to be seen’

original: sdig pa mthol ba la bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mthol ba la bya ste /
translated: refers to confessing misdeeds.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ci byas pa kun bshags te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ci byas pa kun bshags te /
translated: I confess all the evil and nonvirtuous actions I have done since beginningless time up to the present day, in the presence of the noble ones.

original: phyin pa med pa'i gnas su phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa med pa'i gnas su phyin pa'o //
translated: I have arrived at the place of non-going.

original: de bas na gnas de ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gnas de ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that place is fearless.

original: dper na / rgyal po lam du zhugs te song na lam ga nas mi rgod la sogs pa 'byol zhing 'bros so //
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po lam du zhugs te song na lam ga nas mi rgod la sogs pa 'byol zhing 'bros so //
translated: For example, when a king goes out on a journey, the bandits and so forth flee and escape from the road.

original: de bzhin du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyang mthol zhing bshags na thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyang mthol zhing bshags na thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if one confesses and reveals the evil and nonvirtuous actions, all will be purified.

original: gzhan yang byed pa mi mthong ba ni log sred can dag sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas kyang mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byed pa mi mthong ba ni log sred can dag sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas kyang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, not seeing the doer refers to those with wrong views who do evil and nonvirtuous actions but do not see them.

original: log sred can dag ni nga rgyal gyi dregs pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang du byas kyang thog ma nas mi skrag mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: log sred can dag ni nga rgyal gyi dregs pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang du byas kyang thog ma nas mi skrag mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Those with wrong views, through the arrogance of pride, do many evil and nonvirtuous actions but are not afraid or terrified from the beginning.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob pa ni /🔽dper na / spre'u dag chu'i nang @219a *//
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob pa ni / dper na / spre'u dag chu'i nang @219a *//
translated: Therefore, not attaining nirvana

original: gi zla ba 'dzin pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gi zla ba 'dzin pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: is like, for example, monkeys grasping at the moon in the water.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gal te tshad med pa'i sems can thams cad gcig car dus gcig tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang log sred can dag byang chub thob par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te tshad med pa'i sems can thams cad gcig car dus gcig tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang log sred can dag byang chub thob par mi rigs te /
translated: Even if all sentient beings without measure were to simultaneously and at once fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, those Thus-Gone Ones would still not be able to cause those with wrong desires to attain enlightenment.

original: de bas na bya ba mi mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bya ba mi mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called 'not seeing what is to be done.'

original: gzhan yang sus byas pa mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sus byas pa mi mthong zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if you ask who does not see what is done,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: it is that the Thus-Gone One does not see what is done.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i skye bo la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan cing bshad kyang log sred can dag ni 'khor ba na yongs su 'khor bas shes par ram /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i skye bo la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan cing bshad kyang log sred can dag ni 'khor ba na yongs su 'khor bas shes par ram /
translated: Although the Thus-Gone One has taught and explained the buddha-nature to ordinary beings, those with wrong desires, while revolving in saṃsāra, will not understand it

original: mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or see it.

analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa mi mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called 'the Thus-Gone One not seeing what is done.'

original: gzhan yang log sred can dag ni mthar de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das te yang dag par mi rtag par 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang log sred can dag ni mthar de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das te yang dag par mi rtag par 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Moreover, those who have wrong views, when the Tathagata finally passes away, will think that he is truly impermanent.

original: ji ltar mar me dang mar bcas par zad pa lta bur mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me dang mar bcas par zad pa lta bur mthong ba'o //
translated: They will see it as if a lamp and the oil it contains were exhausted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang zag de sdig pa mi dge ba'i las mi 'bri ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag de sdig pa mi dge ba'i las mi 'bri ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those people will not diminish their sinful, unwholesome actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig dge ba byas pa'i las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig dge ba byas pa'i las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa na /
translated: When a bodhisattva dedicates the wholesome actions he has done to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: log sred can dag ni de la 'phya zhing ma dad mod kyi /
analyzed: log sred can dag ni de la 'phya zhing ma dad mod kyi /
translated: those who have wrong views will ridicule and have no faith in that.

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de dag kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de dag kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, bodhisattvas dedicate even those [actions] to the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the Buddhas is like that.

original: 'o @219b ma las ni zhor 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'o @219b ma las ni zhor 'gyur zhing //
translated: From milk comes curd,

original: sdig pa 'phral du smin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa 'phral du smin mi 'gyur //
translated: Evil does not ripen immediately,

original: me mdag thal bas yog pa la //
analyzed: me mdag thal bas yog pa la //
translated: like the ashes of burned grain.

original: glen pa brnyas pas rdzi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: glen pa brnyas pas rdzi bar 'gyur //
translated: The fool is overcome by contempt.

original: log sred can dag ni mig med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: log sred can dag ni mig med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have wrong views are called “blind.”

original: de bas na dgra bcom pa'i lam mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na dgra bcom pa'i lam mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, they do not see the path of the arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa ni 'khor ba'i lam ngan pa g-yang sar mi 'gro'o //🔽mig med pa dag ni shin tu rgyas pa la skur bas dgra bcom pa ltar byams pa'i sems la nan tan mi byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni 'khor ba'i lam ngan pa g-yang sar mi 'gro'o // mig med pa dag ni shin tu rgyas pa la skur bas dgra bcom pa ltar byams pa'i sems la nan tan mi byed do //
translated: The arhat does not go to the abyss of the bad paths of cyclic existence.🔽The blind, by denying the extensive , do not practice the loving mind as do the arhats.

original: log sred can dag shin tu rgyas pa la nan tan mi byed pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: log sred can dag shin tu rgyas pa la nan tan mi byed pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those who have wrong views do not practice the extensive .

original: skyes bu gang zhig 'di skad du bdag ni nyan thos pa'i mdo sde la ma dad kyi /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig 'di skad du bdag ni nyan thos pa'i mdo sde la ma dad kyi /
translated: If someone were to say, “I have no faith in the sūtras of the disciples,

analyzed: theg pa chen po la dad de 'don pa dang / klog pa dang / ston cing 'chad pa'ang byed do //
translated: but I have faith in the Great Vehicle, and I recite it, read it, and teach it and explain it,”

original: de bas na bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: then I would say, “That person is a bodhisattva.

original: sems can thams cad la yang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pas sems can gyi lus kyi nang na stobs bcu dang / mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'ang yod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pas sems can gyi lus kyi nang na stobs bcu dang / mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'ang yod do //
translated: Since all sentient beings have the buddha-nature, within the bodies of sentient beings there are the ten powers, the thirty-two major marks, and the eighty minor marks.

original: bdag smra ba dang / sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa tha mi dad do //
analyzed: bdag smra ba dang / sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa tha mi dad do //
translated: I am no different from the Buddha’s teachings.

original: bdag dang khyed bcas su tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang khyed bcas su tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: You and I will destroy immeasurable afflictions.

original: ji ltar chu snod chag pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa kun bcom pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes skyes bu des de skad du ston cing 'chad mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar chu snod chag pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa kun bcom pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes skyes bu des de skad du ston cing 'chad mod kyi /
translated: Just as a broken water vessel is destroyed, so too will all afflictions be destroyed, and you will see unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.”

original: sems can la yang dag par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par yid ches pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can la yang dag par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par yid ches pa ma yin te /
translated: Although that person teaches and explains in this way, he does not believe that sentient beings have the buddha-nature.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir yi ge las 'byung ba bzhin ston @220a *//
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir yi ge las 'byung ba bzhin ston @220a *//
translated: For the sake of benefit and happiness, he teaches in accordance with the words.

original: te; de ltar ston pa de ni sdig pa can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: te; de ltar ston pa de ni sdig pa can zhes bya ste /
translated: Such a teacher is called sinful.

original: sdig pa can de ni ji ltar 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba bzhin du 'bras bu myur du mi 'grub ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa can de ni ji ltar 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba bzhin du 'bras bu myur du mi 'grub ba'o //
translated: The sinful one is like milk turning into curd, and the result is not quickly accomplished.

original: dper na / rgyal bo'i pho nya shin tu smra mkhas la thabs dang ldan pa zhig yul gzhan du bka' stsal te btang na lus dang srog la bab kyang rgyal po'i bka' mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: dper na / rgyal bo'i pho nya shin tu smra mkhas la thabs dang ldan pa zhig yul gzhan du bka' stsal te btang na lus dang srog la bab kyang rgyal po'i bka' mi 'chab bo //
translated: For example, if a king's messenger is very eloquent and has skill, and is sent to another country on an errand, even at the risk of his life and body, he does not conceal the king's words.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The wise and the learned are like this.

original: byis pa ma rabs kyi nang du lus dang srog la mi lta bar theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa sgrogs shing ston to //
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs kyi nang du lus dang srog la mi lta bar theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa sgrogs shing ston to //
translated: In the midst of the ignorant and the wicked, they do not care for their lives and bodies, and proclaim and teach the Great Vehicle, the extensive teaching of the Tathagata's essence, that all sentient beings have the Buddha-nature.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: log sred can 'ga' zhig dgra bcom pa ltar 'chos te /
analyzed: log sred can 'ga' zhig dgra bcom pa ltar 'chos te /
translated: Some of the icchantikas pretend to be arhats,

original: bas mthar gnas nam  shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la 'phya zhing skur na bus pa ma rabs dag de la yang dag par dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: bas mthar gnas nam  shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la 'phya zhing skur na bus pa ma rabs dag de la yang dag par dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: If one lives in the wilderness and disparages and slanders the Mahāyāna sūtras of the vaipulya,🔽foolish people will think that he is a true arhat

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par 'dzin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par 'dzin te /

original: log sred can dge sbyong sdig pa can de bas mthar gnas kyang /
analyzed: log sred can dge sbyong sdig pa can de bas mthar gnas kyang /
translated: even though living in the wilderness,

original: bas mthar gnas pa'i chos ma rung bar byed do //
analyzed: bas mthar gnas pa'i chos ma rung bar byed do //
translated: ruins the Dharma of living in the wilderness.

original: pha rol pos rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pa la phrag dog gi sems skyes nas 'di skad du shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'ang bdud sdig to can gyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol pos rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pa la phrag dog gi sems skyes nas 'di skad du shin tu rgyas pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'ang bdud sdig to can gyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: Out of jealousy toward others' gains and honors, he says, 'Even the Mahāyāna sūtras of the vaipulya were taught by the evil Māra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang mi rtag pa'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang mi rtag pa'o zhes smras te /
translated: The Tathāgata is impermanent.'

original: dam pa'i chos la 'jig cing dge 'dun ma rung bar byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la 'jig cing dge 'dun ma rung bar byed do //
translated: He destroys the true Dharma and ruins the Saṅgha.

original: @220b gzhan yang 'di las du bdud sdig to can gyis smras pa ni dge ba'i rjes su smras pa ma yin no zhes sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de skad ces smras te /
analyzed: @220b gzhan yang 'di las du bdud sdig to can gyis smras pa ni dge ba'i rjes su smras pa ma yin no zhes sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de skad ces smras te /
translated: Moreover, what the evil Māra says here is not a statement that follows what is wholesome.

original: sdig pa de ltar byas kyang 'o ma las zhog 'gyur ba bzhin du 'bral du smin pa'ang ma yin pas /
analyzed: sdig pa de ltar byas kyang 'o ma las zhog 'gyur ba bzhin du 'bral du smin pa'ang ma yin pas /
translated: Even though one acts in such a way, it is not as if one were to separate milk from curds, so that it does not ripen into evil.

original: me mdag thal bas  bkab pa la brnyas pa bzhin du steng du rdzi'o //
analyzed: me mdag thal bas  bkab pa la brnyas pa bzhin du steng du rdzi'o //
translated: Like a fire covered with ashes, it will flare up again.

original: gang zag de ni log sred dan  zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni log sred dan  zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That person is called one who has the strength of wrong views.

analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde dam pa 'di nges par yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this excellent, vast sūtra of the Great Vehicle is definitely pure.

original: nor bu rin po che chu rnyog pa can gyi nang du bcug na chu dang bar 'gyur ba ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde 'di'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chu rnyog pa can gyi nang du bcug na chu dang bar 'gyur ba ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde 'di'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as when a precious gem is placed in muddy water, the water becomes clear, so it is with this sūtra of the Great Vehicle.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / me tog padmo dag nyi ma'i 'od kyis phog ma thag tu kha 'bye'o //
translated: For example, when lotus flowers are struck by the sun's rays, they open up.

original: sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: All sentient beings are like this.

analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa chen po nyi ma lta bu mthong na sems ma bskyed pa dag sems bskyed cing byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'od ba spu'i bu gar zhugs na rgyu dam par 'gyur ro zhes ngas gsungs so //
translated: Therefore I say that the light of nirvana, when it enters the pores of the skin, becomes a supreme cause.

original: log sred can ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod kyang kha na ma tho ba'i dri ma tshad med pa snyed kyis glags pas mi thar ba ni ji ltar dar gyi srin bu'i khog pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: log sred can ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod kyang kha na ma tho ba'i dri ma tshad med pa snyed kyis glags pas mi thar ba ni ji ltar dar gyi srin bu'i khog pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: As for those with perverted desires, even though they have buddha-nature, they are unable to be liberated because they are covered by immeasurable defilements and transgressions, just as a silkworm is encased in a cocoon.

analyzed: las de lta bu'i rkyen gyis byang chub kyi rgyu mi skye ste /
translated: Because of such karma, the cause of enlightenment does not arise,

analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ba'i mtha' mi zad par gyur to //
translated: and they revolve in cyclic existence without end.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas mod kyi /

original: rigs kyi bu /

translated: Son of good family!

analyzed: dper na / yul la la na shin tu bsil ba'i rlung dang ldan na /
translated: For example, if there is a place that has a very cool breeze,

analyzed: sems can gang tsha bas gdungs pa'i lus kyi ba spu'i khung la reg na tsha bas gdungs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if it touches the pores of the bodies of sentient beings tormented by heat, the torment of heat will disappear.

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di'ang de dang 'dra'o //

translated: They can cure the illnesses of the afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance of all sentient beings and remove the pains of the afflictions,

translated: Son of noble family,

translated: This Mahāyāna sūtra, the Great Nirvana, is also like this.

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can yang shes rab kyi mig thob cing /

analyzed: tshad med mtha' yas pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la dgod pa dang / sems ma bskyed pa phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dag kyang byang chub tu sems skyed par byed ni nus kyi / thog ma nas dmus @222a *//
translated: and it can cause those who have not yet aroused the mind of awakening, those who have transgressed the four defeats, and those who have committed the five heinous crimes to arouse the mind of awakening,

translated: Those who have committed the four defeats and the five heinous acts, and those who have not given rise to the mind of awakening, will give rise to the mind of awakening, except for those with perverted desires.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
