translated: those who have committed the four defeats and the five heinous acts are like a palm tree whose crown has been cut off, which will not grow again.

original: de dag byang chub tu sems ma @222b bskyed pa ci'i slad du byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag byang chub tu sems ma @222b bskyed pa ci'i slad du byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Why would those who have not given rise to the mind of awakening become a cause of awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sems can de dag gal te rmi lam na sems can dmyal bar ltung ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag gal te rmi lam na sems can dmyal bar ltung ste /
translated: if those sentient beings were to fall into the hells in a dream,

original: sdug bsngal mang po myong ba rmis na 'gyod pa'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po myong ba rmis na 'gyod pa'i sems skyes te /
translated: If he dreams that he experiences many sufferings, he will feel remorse.

original: kyi hud / bdag ci'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i sdig pa myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kyi hud / bdag ci'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i sdig pa myong bar 'gyur /
translated: “Alas! Why did I experience such evil?

original: bdag ci ste sdig pa 'di las thar na gdon mi za bar byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ci ste sdig pa 'di las thar na gdon mi za bar byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: If I am to be freed from this evil, I will certainly arouse the thought of awakening.

original: da ltar myong ba 'di ni rab tu'ang sdug bsngal ba'o snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: da ltar myong ba 'di ni rab tu'ang sdug bsngal ba'o snyam bsams nas /
translated: The present experience is extremely painful.”

original: de nas sad de dam pa'i chos la 'bras bu chen po dang ldan par shes so //
analyzed: de nas sad de dam pa'i chos la 'bras bu chen po dang ldan par shes so //
translated: Then, when he awakens, he will understand that the holy Dharma has great fruits.

original: ji ltar bu chung du bags kyis cher skyes kyi bar du rtag tu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: ji ltar bu chung du bags kyis cher skyes kyi bar du rtag tu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Just as a small child gradually grows up, he will always think like this:

original: sman pa de ni sman la shin tu mkhas so //
analyzed: sman pa de ni sman la shin tu mkhas so //
translated: “That doctor was very skilled in medicine.

original: bdag mngal na 'dug pa las bdag gi ma la sman btang bas sman gyi mthus bde bar gyur te /
analyzed: bdag mngal na 'dug pa las bdag gi ma la sman btang bas sman gyi mthus bde bar gyur te /
translated: When I was in the womb, he gave medicine to my mother. By the power of the medicine, she became well.

original: bdag kyang 'tsho bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag kyang 'tsho bar gyur to //
translated: I also became alive.

original: ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: How wonderful!

original: bdag gi mas zla ba bcu'i bar du sdug bsngal chen po myong ste /
analyzed: bdag gi mas zla ba bcu'i bar du sdug bsngal chen po myong ste /
translated: My mother experienced great suffering for ten months.

original: bdag btsas nas kyang gsher ba mi bde ba dang ni bral /
analyzed: bdag btsas nas kyang gsher ba mi bde ba dang ni bral /
translated: Since my birth, I have been free from the discomfort of wetness.

original: skam pa bde ba dang ni sprad de /🔽mi gtsang ba bshang gci che chung yang phyags nas nu zho bsnun te /
analyzed: skam pa bde ba dang ni sprad de / mi gtsang ba bshang gci che chung yang phyags nas nu zho bsnun te /
translated: I have been given the comfort of dryness.🔽I have been nursed with milk,

original: bdag gi lus 'di dag gsos nas rim gro cher byas so //
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di dag gsos nas rim gro cher byas so //
translated: and my body has been nourished and served with great care.

original: de bas na bdag kyang drin la lan glan pa'i phyir rim gro cher byas te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag kyang drin la lan glan pa'i phyir rim gro cher byas te /
translated: Therefore, in order to repay my mother’s kindness, I will serve her with great care.

original: yid dang mi 'gal bar mchod pa bya'o snyam sems so //
analyzed: yid dang mi 'gal bar mchod pa bya'o snyam sems so //
translated: I will make offerings without going against her wishes.

original: phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa'i sdig byas pa'ang mthar dus @223a *//
analyzed: phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa'i sdig byas pa'ang mthar dus @223a *//
translated: Even if one has committed the four grave offenses or the five heinous crimes,

original: byed pa na /
analyzed: byed pa na /
translated: at the time of death,

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di dran par byas na sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di dran par byas na sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: if one recalls this Mahāyāna sūtra, the Great Nirvāṇa, one will be reborn as a human, a god,🔽an animal,

original: yi dvags sam /
analyzed: yi dvags sam /
translated: a hungry ghost,

original: lha'am mir skyes kyang mdo sde 'dis mi de'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'am mir skyes kyang mdo sde 'dis mi de'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: or in the hells. This sūtra will cause that person’s bodhicitta to arise.

original: log sred can ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: log sred can ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This excludes those with wrong views.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Furthermore, it is like this.

original: dper na / sman pa mkhas pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / sman pa mkhas pa'am /
translated: For example, a skilled doctor

original: sman pa mkhas pa'i bu sman pa gzhan las 'phags par mkhas pa dug gi sman la'ang shin tu mkhas shing /
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa'i bu sman pa gzhan las 'phags par mkhas pa dug gi sman la'ang shin tu mkhas shing /
translated: or the son of a skilled doctor, who is more skilled than other doctors, is very skilled in the medicine for poison,🔽and is also skilled in mantras.

original: rigs sngags la'ang mkhas na sbrul gdug pa'am /
analyzed: rigs sngags la'ang mkhas na sbrul gdug pa'am /
translated: Even poisonous snakes,

original: klu'am / gdug pa gzhan dag kyang rig sngags dang sman gyi mthus gdug pa med par byed do //
analyzed: klu'am / gdug pa gzhan dag kyang rig sngags dang sman gyi mthus gdug pa med par byed do //
translated: dragons, or other poisons, through the power of mantras and medicine, are made non-poisonous.

original: gal te lham la sman bkus te /
analyzed: gal te lham la sman bkus te /
translated: If one anoints one's shoes with medicine

original: sbrul gdug pa la sogs pa la reg na gdug pa zhi bar 'gyur yang /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa la sogs pa la reg na gdug pa zhi bar 'gyur yang /
translated: and touches poisonous snakes, etc., the poison will be pacified.

original: gdug pa klu chen po zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdug pa klu chen po zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not called the great poison of the dragon.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: This Mahāyāna sūtra, the Great Nirvāṇa, is also like that.

original: sems can gang phas pham pa bzhi nyams sam /
analyzed: sems can gang phas pham pa bzhi nyams sam /
translated: For any sentient being who has committed the four defeats

original: mtshams med pa lnga byas kyang de dag gi kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa byang zhing byang chub la dgod par byed do //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byas kyang de dag gi kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa byang zhing byang chub la dgod par byed do //
translated: or the five heinous acts, it purifies the evil of their misdeeds and establishes them in enlightenment.

original: lham la sman gyis bskus na'ang dug zhi bar byed pa ltar sems ma bskyed pa dag kyang sems bskyed cing byang chub la bde bar dgod par byed do //
analyzed: lham la sman gyis bskus na'ang dug zhi bar byed pa ltar sems ma bskyed pa dag kyang sems bskyed cing byang chub la bde bar dgod par byed do //
translated: Just as medicine can be used to heal even a poisoned shoe, so too can I lead those who have not yet developed the aspiration to enlightenment to the bliss of enlightenment.

original: theg pa chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde sman lta bu 'di'i mthus sems can thams cad bde bar byed @223b kyang klu chen po lta bu log sred can dag ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde sman lta bu 'di'i mthus sems can thams cad bde bar byed @223b kyang klu chen po lta bu log sred can dag ni ma gtogs so //
translated: By the power of this Mahāyāna sūtra, the medicine of great nirvāṇa, I will bring happiness to all sentient beings, except for those great nāgas who have the wrong views.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / mi zhig gis dug rnam par sbyar nas rnga chen po la bskus te mi mang po'i nang du brdungs na sgra de thos par mi 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig gis dug rnam par sbyar nas rnga chen po la bskus te mi mang po'i nang du brdungs na sgra de thos par mi 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Suppose someone were to mix poison into a large drum, beat it, and play it in the middle of a crowd of people. Although no one wants to hear that sound,

original: thos pa thams cad 'chi yang glo bur du 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: thos pa thams cad 'chi yang glo bur du 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ni ma gtogs so //
translated: everyone who hears it will die, except for those who have suddenly died.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: This Mahāyāna sūtra, the Mahāparinirvāṇa, is like that.

original: gang dang gang na 'du byed mang po'i nang du sgra thos par gyur na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa kun 'byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang na 'du byed mang po'i nang du sgra thos par gyur na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa kun 'byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Wherever the sound of this sutra is heard, all the afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance will be purified.

original: de la sems shing yid la bya ba'i bsam pa med kyang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mthus nyon mongs pa kun zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sems shing yid la bya ba'i bsam pa med kyang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mthus nyon mongs pa kun zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one does not think about it or pay attention to it, through the power of great nirvana, all afflictions will be pacified.

original: phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dag kyang mdo sde 'di thos na bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dag kyang mdo sde 'di thos na bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Even those who have committed the four defeats and five heinous acts will, if they hear this sutra, have it become a cause for unsurpassed awakening.

original: nyon mongs pa khang kyis 'byang bar 'gyur na glo bur du mi 'chi ba log sred can ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa khang kyis 'byang bar 'gyur na glo bur du mi 'chi ba log sred can ni ma gtogs so //
translated: If it purifies even the afflictions of the hell realms, what need is there to speak of those who are not hell beings?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

original: dper na; mun sros na las bya ba thams cad gtong ste /
analyzed: dper na; mun sros na las bya ba thams cad gtong ste /
translated: When darkness falls, all work is suspended.

original: 'phro lus kyang sang gi bar du sdod do //
analyzed: 'phro lus kyang sang gi bar du sdod do //
translated: Even unfinished tasks must wait until tomorrow.

original: theg pa chen po slob pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po slob pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The training in the Great Vehicle is also like this.

original: mdo sde'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la nan tan byas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po nyi ma lta bu 'di las de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa 'di thos nas gdod byang chub kyi las byed de /
analyzed: mdo sde'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la nan tan byas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po nyi ma lta bu 'di las de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa 'di thos nas gdod byang chub kyi las byed de /
translated: Although they may have practiced all the meditative concentrations of the sūtras, they will not have done the work of enlightenment until they have heard this teaching, which the Tathāgata has spoken with a hidden intention, this Great Nirvana that is like the sun.

original: dam pa'i chos la bde bar gnas so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la bde bar gnas so //
translated: Then they will abide in bliss in the true teaching.

original: @224a *// dper na /
analyzed: @224a *// dper na /
translated: For example,

original: char pa ni sa bon thams cad skye ba dang / 'bras bu thams cad smin pa dang / mu ge la sogs pa sel cing longs spyod dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: char pa ni sa bon thams cad skye ba dang / 'bras bu thams cad smin pa dang / mu ge la sogs pa sel cing longs spyod dang ldan par byed do //
translated: rain makes all seeds grow, ripens all fruits, removes famine, and so on, and brings about abundance.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po chos kyi char tshad med pa 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po chos kyi char tshad med pa 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: This Dharma rain of the Tathāgata’s heart is like that.

original: gdung ba'i nang rnam pa brgyad sel ba dang / mdo sde 'di 'jig rten du byung bas 'bras bu thams cad smin par byed pa dang / thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba dang / so so'i skye bo dag sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong ba ji ltar punda ri ka'i mdo las nyan thos brgyad stong rnams la lung bstan te 'bras bu chen po thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gdung ba'i nang rnam pa brgyad sel ba dang / mdo sde 'di 'jig rten du byung bas 'bras bu thams cad smin par byed pa dang / thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba dang / so so'i skye bo dag sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong ba ji ltar punda ri ka'i mdo las nyan thos brgyad stong rnams la lung bstan te 'bras bu chen po thob pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the Pundarika Sutra, the eight thousand shravakas were given predictions and attained great fruition.

original: ji ltar ston gyi dus su las byas nas dgun sbed pa ltar las gzhan mi byed pa log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ston gyi dus su las byas nas dgun sbed pa ltar las gzhan mi byed pa log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as in autumn, when the work is done, one hides for the winter, so the icchantikas do not do any other work.

original: dge ba'i chos la rtsol ba med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la rtsol ba med do //
translated: They do not strive for virtuous dharmas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this.

original: dper na / sman pa mkhas pa zhig pha rol po'i bu zhig 'dres brlams zhes thos na sman bzang po sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na / sman pa mkhas pa zhig pha rol po'i bu zhig 'dres brlams zhes thos na sman bzang po sbyar te /
translated: For example, if a skilled doctor hears that someone else's child is possessed by a demon, he will prepare good medicine,

original: mi gcig de'i steng du mngags nas 'di skad ces khyod sman 'di thogs la de'i gan du skyol cig /
analyzed: mi gcig de'i steng du mngags nas 'di skad ces khyod sman 'di thogs la de'i gan du skyol cig /
translated: He would then send someone to take the medicine to the sick person.

original: ci ste mngags pa'i mi de nyid lam du yi dvags dang phrad na'ang sman de'i stobs kyis 'byol zhing 'bros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste mngags pa'i mi de nyid lam du yi dvags dang phrad na'ang sman de'i stobs kyis 'byol zhing 'bros par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the person sent on the errand were to encounter a hungry ghost on the way, the power of the medicine would cause him to go around and avoid it.🔽Even if he were to encounter it, he would not be afraid.

original: khyod ci ste thogs na'ang kho bo nyid don du 'gro ste /
analyzed: khyod ci ste thogs na'ang kho bo nyid don du 'gro ste /
translated: If he were to be delayed, the man himself would go to the sick person.

original: nad pa de glo bur gyis 'chi bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa de glo bur gyis 'chi bar mi bya'o //
translated: He would not allow the sick person to die suddenly.

original: ci ste nang pa des mngags pa'i mi de'am /
analyzed: ci ste nang pa des mngags pa'i mi de'am /
translated: If the sick person were to meet the man sent on the errand

original: kho bo nyid dang phrad na sman @224b gyi stobs kyis nad kyi sdug bsngal dang bral te bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bo nyid dang phrad na sman @224b gyi stobs kyis nad kyi sdug bsngal dang bral te bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he were to meet the man himself, the power of the medicine would cause him to be free from the suffering of illness and to be happy.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di yang de dang 'dra ste /🔽dge slong ngam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di yang de dang 'dra ste / dge slong ngam /
translated: This Mahayana sutra, the Great Nirvana Sutra, is also like this.🔽Whether it be a bhiksu,

original: dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am /
translated: a bhiksuni,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: a layman,🔽a laywoman,

original: dge bsnyen ma'am /🔽mu stegs can la sogs pa gang su'ang rung ste /🔽mdo sde 'di 'chang ngam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'am / mu stegs can la sogs pa gang su'ang rung ste / mdo sde 'di 'chang ngam /
translated: or a heretic,🔽if any of them hold this sutra,

original: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
analyzed: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
translated: recite it,

original: 'don tam / khong du chud par byed dam /
analyzed: 'don tam / khong du chud par byed dam /
translated: If they recite it, or understand it,

original: gzhan la rgyas par ston cing 'chad dam /
analyzed: gzhan la rgyas par ston cing 'chad dam /
translated: or explain it in detail to others,

original: bdag gis glegs bam du bris sam /
analyzed: bdag gis glegs bam du bris sam /
translated: or write it out in a book themselves,

original: gzhan 'drir bcug na de dag thams cad byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //🔽gal te phas pham pa bzhi nyams sam /
analyzed: gzhan 'drir bcug na de dag thams cad byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro // gal te phas pham pa bzhi nyams sam /
translated: or cause others to write it out, all of these will become causes of enlightenment.🔽If they have committed the four grave offenses,

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i sdig byas sam /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i sdig byas sam /
translated: or the five heinous crimes,

original: yi dvags kyis brlams sam /
analyzed: yi dvags kyis brlams sam /
translated: or have been possessed by a hungry ghost,

original: gdug pas gnod par gyur pa dag mdo sde 'di thos na sdig pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdug pas gnod par gyur pa dag mdo sde 'di thos na sdig pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or have been harmed by a demon, if they hear this sutra, all their sins will be extinguished.

original: ji ltar sman pa mkhas pa de mthong na yi dvags la sogs pa 'byol zhing 'bros pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sman pa mkhas pa de mthong na yi dvags la sogs pa 'byol zhing 'bros pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as when they see a skilled doctor, hungry ghosts and so on flee in all directions.

original: de bas na de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the bodhisattva-mahasattva’s true practice.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thos pa tsam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag go bar bsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thos pa tsam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag go bar bsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because merely hearing the Mahayana Great Nirvana Sutra and thinking that the Tathagata is eternal is the cause of the bodhisattva-mahasattva’s true practice.

original: thos pa tsam gyis kyang de lta bur 'gyur na /🔽glegs bam du 'dri'am /🔽'chang ngam / 'dzin tam /
analyzed: thos pa tsam gyis kyang de lta bur 'gyur na / glegs bam du 'dri'am / 'chang ngam / 'dzin tam /
translated: If this is so even for those who merely hear it,🔽what need is there to mention those who copy it,🔽keep it, read it, recite it,

original: klog gam / 'don pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: klog gam / 'don pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: or explain it?

original: log sred can ma gtog /
analyzed: log sred can ma gtog /
translated: Except for those with perverted desires,

original: bar thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: all of them should be known as bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan @225a *// yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan @225a *// yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

original: dper na / 'on pas sgra skad ci'ang mi thos so //
analyzed: dper na / 'on pas sgra skad ci'ang mi thos so //
translated: For example, a deaf person does not hear any sounds at all.

original: log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: log sred can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Those with perverted desires are also like this.

original: mdo sde dam pa 'di nyan par rtsol yang mi thos so //
analyzed: mdo sde dam pa 'di nyan par rtsol yang mi thos so //
translated: Even though they strive to listen to this sublime sūtra, they do not hear it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: The wise should be very learned in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'das 'jig rten du byung nas sems can dag la de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa bshad pas skyes bu mkhas pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas rtag par 'dzin pa la mi rtag par bstan par shes te /

translated: The Bhagavān Buddha appeared in the world and explained to sentient beings that the Tathāgata is in nirvāṇa. The wise should understand that the Tathāgata taught impermanence to those who grasp permanence.

original: dge slong dag ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he made bhikṣus practice the characteristics of impermanence.

original: gzhan yang ched 'ga'i dus na dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas skyes bu mkhas pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas gang bde bar 'dzin pa la sdug bsngal bstan par shes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ched 'ga'i dus na dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas skyes bu mkhas pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pas gang bde bar 'dzin pa la sdug bsngal bstan par shes te /
translated: Moreover, he taught that at a certain time the true Dharma will perish. The wise should understand that the Tathāgata taught suffering to those who grasp happiness.

original: dge slong dag sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he made bhikṣus practice the characteristics of suffering.

original: gzhan yang 'di skad du nga la na ba'i sdug bsngal yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di skad du nga la na ba'i sdug bsngal yod de /
translated: Moreover, it is taught: “I have the suffering of illness.🔽The Saṅgha will also be destroyed.”

translated: Thus, wise persons understand that the Tathāgata teaches selflessness to those who grasp at a self.

original: dge slong dag bdag med pa la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag bdag med pa la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to make the monks practice selflessness.🔽Sometimes it is taught: “What is called emptiness is complete liberation.”

original: ched 'ga' 'di skad du stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'o zhes bstan pas skyes bu mkhas pa dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par rnam par grol par bstan gyi /🔽srid pa nyi shu lnga po ni med par shes te /
analyzed: ched 'ga' 'di skad du stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'o zhes bstan pas skyes bu mkhas pa dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par rnam par grol par bstan gyi / srid pa nyi shu lnga po ni med par shes te /
translated: Thus, wise persons understand that the Tathāgata teaches complete liberation.

original: dge slong dag stong pa nyid la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir @229b ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag stong pa nyid la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir @229b ro //
translated: It is in order to make the monks practice emptiness.

original: de bas na yang dag par rnam par grol ba ni stong pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par rnam par grol ba ni stong pa nyid do zhes bstan to //

original: mi g-yo ba g-yo ba med pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba g-yo ba med pa zhes kyang bya ste /

analyzed: rnam par grol ba de la sdug bsngal ba med pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “unmoving” because there is no suffering in that liberation.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol ba ni mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol ba ni mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Correct liberation” is called “signless” because it is without signs.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “signless” because it is without form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and so on.

analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol ba ni rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba ste /
translated: “Correct liberation” is permanent, unchanging, and does not pass away.

analyzed: rnam par grol ba la mi rtag pa dang / gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'pho ba med pas /
translated: Because impermanence, distress, and passing away are absent in liberation,

original: de bas na rnam par grol ba ni rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur ba bsil ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par grol ba ni rtag pa gnas pa mi 'gyur ba bsil ba'o //
translated: liberation is permanent, stable, tranquil, and unchanging.

original: gal te sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yod pa bstan na de la skyes bu mkhas pas ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos bstan pa te /

translated: If I were to teach that all sentient beings have the nature of the Tathāgata, then the wise would understand that the Tathāgata has taught the Dharma of permanence.

original: dge slong dag yang dag par rtag pa'i chos la nan tan byed du gzhug par shes so //
analyzed: dge slong dag yang dag par rtag pa'i chos la nan tan byed du gzhug par shes so //
translated: Bhikṣus, you should know that I teach the Dharma of permanence in order to make you practice.

original: dge slong dag de ltar rjes su nan tan byed cing slob pa de ni nga'i nye gnas yang dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar rjes su nan tan byed cing slob pa de ni nga'i nye gnas yang dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Bhikṣus, those who practice and study in this way should be known as my true disciples.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po la mkhas pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po la mkhas pa de ni /
translated: Those who are skilled in the essence of the Tathāgata’s intentional teachings

analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po chen po de'i blon po mkhas pas rgyal po'i bsam pa shes pa dang 'dra'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: de ltar rgyal chen po de la'ang man dag tu smra ba'i tshig yod na de @230a *//

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa ni shin tu shes par dka' ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten na byis pa glen pa dag gis shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang chu las skyes pa thams cad kyang snum med la /

analyzed: tshad du phyin par mi skye zhing sman thams cad kyang mthu chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and do not grow to their full size, and all the medicines become weak.

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: nga mya ngan las 'das nas sems can dag bsti stang mi byed de /

analyzed: gzi brjid kyang chung bar 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Because those sentient beings do not understand what the Tathāgata has said with a specific intention.

original: de'ang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: sems can dag bsod nams chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dag bsod nams chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings have little merit.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig cing zad du nye ba na de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong sdig pa spyod pa mang ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po mi shes @230b pas le lo dang / snyom las byed de /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i chos klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / rnam par 'byed cing ston mi nus so //

translated: even if a single particle were offered to a single Buddha, it would not be sufficient or pervade. However, through the blessing of the Tathāgata,

original: thams cad khyed cing chog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad khyed cing chog par 'gyur ro //

translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta and others understood these wondrous and marvelous things.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: sangs rgyas nyag gcig sman gyi sdong po ltar bzhugs shing /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yongs su bskor bar mthong ngo //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tsunda la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tsunda la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The World-Honored One said to Cunda:

original: khyod kyis sngar sangs @244a *//

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa // de de bzhin no //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /

analyzed: pha rol gzhan gyis smras pa la //

original: rjes su gzhol gyi phyir mi bzlog /

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: ngas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa 'di'ang sems can thams cad kyi phyir ni ma yin gyi /

analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po ma skyes dgra 'ba' zhig gi phyir gsungs te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rgyu @251a *//

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen yod pas na de skad ces gsungs pa yin no //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu byung bar gnang zhes dris nas /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis rgyal po de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces smras so //

original: pha rol gzhan gyis smras pa la //
analyzed: pha rol gzhan gyis smras pa la //
translated: ‘When others speak to you,🔽respond without turning away.

original: rjes su gzhol gyi phyir mi bzlog /
analyzed: rjes su gzhol gyi phyir mi bzlog /
translated: Do not investigate

original: gzhan gyis byas dang ma byas pa //🔽de la brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas dang ma byas pa // de la brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: what others have done or not done.

analyzed: bdag gi lus la shin tu brtag /

analyzed: dge dang mi dge gang spyod pa //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rgyal po chen po pha bsad pa'i mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i las byas kyi /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

translated: I also spoke those verses for those who fully guard their ethics, who are endowed with conduct, and who persist in seeking out the faults of others.

analyzed: gang zag su zhig pha rol pos bstan cing 'chos pa'i rjes su mi dge ba yongs su spong ste /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal la tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke to Mañjuśrī in verse:

analyzed: mtshon chas mi 'jigs gang yang med //

original: bdag gi lus la dpe blangs te //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la dpe blangs te //

analyzed: gzhan la ma 'tshog ma gsod cig /

analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /

original: thams cad mtshon chas 'jigs pa min //
analyzed: thams cad mtshon chas 'jigs pa min //
translated: Not all are afraid of weapons,

original: srog la thams cad chags ma lags //
analyzed: srog la thams cad chags ma lags //
translated: Not all are attached to life.

original: bdag gi lus la dpe blangs te //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la dpe blangs te //
translated: Taking one's own body as an example,

original: dge bar spyod la brtson par bya //
analyzed: dge bar spyod la brtson par bya //
translated: Strive in virtuous conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi tshig gi don gsungs pa 'di'ang bas pa'i mthar phyin pa ma lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi tshig gi don gsungs pa 'di'ang bas pa'i mthar phyin pa ma lags so //
translated: This Dharma verse spoken by the Tathāgata on the meaning of the words does not reach the end of the matter.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgra bcom pa dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bud med rin po che dang / bal glang dang / rta dang / blon po rin po che ni gnam gyi lha'am /

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi mtshon rnon po thogs kyang gsod @252a *// nus pa'i gnas med do //

original: skyes bu dpa' bo dang / bud med chu gang can dang / rta'i rgyal po dang / gcan gzan gyi rgyal po dang / dge slong tshul khrims srung ba ni gnyen po mngon du snang yang mi 'jigs mi skrag pas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa 'di'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
analyzed: skyes bu dpa' bo dang / bud med chu gang can dang / rta'i rgyal po dang / gcan gzan gyi rgyal po dang / dge slong tshul khrims srung ba ni gnyen po mngon du snang yang mi 'jigs mi skrag pas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa 'di'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata’s verse is incomplete.

analyzed: bdag gi lus la dpe blang ngo zhes bgyi ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: “Taking my body as an example” is also incomplete.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci ste dgra bcom pa dag bdag la gzhan gyi dpe len na bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste dgra bcom pa dag bdag la gzhan gyi dpe len na bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If arhats were to take other people as examples, they would have the perception of self and the perception of life.

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa yod na srung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / srog tu 'du shes pa yod na srung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they had the perception of self and the perception of life, they would be protected.

original: byis pa ma rabs dag gis kyang dgra bcom pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs dag gis kyang dgra bcom pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even the ignorant would see the arhats.

original: thams cad rnal 'byor can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad rnal 'byor can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Everyone would be a practitioner.

original: ci ste de lta bu lags na ngan par lta ba lags so //
analyzed: ci ste de lta bu lags na ngan par lta ba lags so //

original: gal te ngan par lta ba lags na tshe 'phos ma thag tu sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ngan par lta ba lags na tshe 'phos ma thag tu sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a bad view, as soon as they died they would be reborn in hell.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa dag ni /
translated: Moreover, arhats

analyzed: sems can thams cad la gsod pa'i sems gal te yang skye ba'i gnas ma mchis so //

analyzed: sems can tshad med pa dag kyang dgra bcom pa la gsod nus pa ma mchis so //
translated: Even if countless sentient beings were to kill an arhat, they would not be able to.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

translated: The idea of self refers to the arising of the thought of great compassion for sentient beings. The idea of killing is absent. This is the equality of mind of the arhats.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rgyu dang rkyen med par 'gal bar gsungs pa yod do snyam ma sems shig /

analyzed: sngon rgyal po'i khab 'di na rngon pa zhig ri dvags mang du bsad nas nga la sha zo zhig ces spyan drangs so //
translated: In the past, in this royal capital, a hunter killed many deer and invited me, saying, 'Eat the meat.'

original: ngas de'i tshe gsol ba gnang mod kyi /
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe gsol ba gnang mod kyi /
translated: At that time, I allowed it.

original: sems can thams cad la sgra gcan 'dzin ltar shin tu byams pa'i sems nye bar bzhag nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sgra gcan 'dzin ltar shin tu byams pa'i sems nye bar bzhag nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces gsungs so //
translated: But I placed a thought of great love for all beings, like Rahula, and spoke this verse:

original: khyod ni shin tu tshe ring zhing //
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu tshe ring zhing //
translated: 'You will have a very long life,

original: 'jig rten 'dir yang ring du 'dug /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir yang ring du 'dug /
translated: and will remain in this world for a long time.

original: mi gsod pa yi chos 'dzin cing //
analyzed: mi gsod pa yi chos 'dzin cing //

original: sangs rgyas tshe dang 'dra bar shog /
analyzed: sangs rgyas tshe dang 'dra bar shog /
translated: may you be like the Buddha in longevity.'

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di yang smras //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di yang smras //
translated: And I spoke this verse:

original: mtshon chas mi 'jigs gang yang med //
analyzed: mtshon chas mi 'jigs gang yang med //

original: 'tsho ba'i srog la thams cad chags //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i srog la thams cad chags //
translated: All are attached to the life of livelihood.

original: bdag gi lus la dpe blangs te //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la dpe blangs te //
translated: Taking my body as an example,

original: 'tshog dang gsod pa ma byed cig /
analyzed: 'tshog dang gsod pa ma byed cig /
translated: Do not beat or kill.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la shin tu legs so //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la shin tu legs so //
translated: Then, the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, Excellent!

original: shin tu legs so zhes bya ba byin nas /
analyzed: shin tu legs so zhes bya ba byin nas /
translated: Excellent!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la don shin tu zab mo 'di lta bu dris pa legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la don shin tu zab mo 'di lta bu dris pa legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
translated: You have asked the Tathāgata about such a profound meaning for the sake of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas. Excellent!

original: de nas 'jam dpal gyis yang tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /🔽ji ltar shin tu pha ma la //🔽bsti stang @253a *//
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gyis yang tshigs su bcad de gsol pa / ji ltar shin tu pha ma la // bsti stang @253a *//
translated: Then Mañjuśrī spoke in verse:🔽Just as one respectfully

original: bcas pas rjes su gzhol //
analyzed: bcas pas rjes su gzhol //
translated: attends to one's parents,

original: ji ltar nyams su blangs pa dag /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su blangs pa dag /
translated: just as one practices

original: mtshams med sems can dmyal bar ltung //
analyzed: mtshams med sems can dmyal bar ltung //
translated: and falls into the Avīci hell,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke in verse to Mañjuśrī:

original: 'dod chags pa ni ma zhes bya //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa ni ma zhes bya //
translated: The mother is desire,

original: ma rig pa ni pha yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni pha yin no //
translated: and ignorance is the father.

original: bsti stang bcas pas rjes 'jug na //
analyzed: bsti stang bcas pas rjes 'jug na //
translated: If one follows them with respect,

original: mtshams med sems can dmyal bar ltung //
analyzed: mtshams med sems can dmyal bar ltung //
translated: one will fall into the hells for the five heinous crimes.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke in verse to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: thams cad gzhan gyis dbang bsgyur na //
analyzed: thams cad gzhan gyis dbang bsgyur na //
translated: When all is controlled by others,

original: de ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya //
translated: that is called suffering.

original: thams cad bdag gis dbang bsgyur na //
analyzed: thams cad bdag gis dbang bsgyur na //
translated: When all is controlled by oneself,

original: de ni dbang dang bde bar ldan //
analyzed: de ni dbang dang bde bar ldan //
translated: that is called power and happiness.

original: nga rgyal dregs pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: nga rgyal dregs pa thams cad ni //
translated: All pride and arrogance

original: mthu dang ldan pas khro gtum che //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pas khro gtum che //
translated: are great wrath and violence when powerful.

original: dge zhing des pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: dge zhing des pa thams cad ni //
translated: All virtue and gentleness

original: kun la byams te snying rjer ldan //
analyzed: kun la byams te snying rjer ldan //
translated: are love and compassion for all.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, again said to the Blessed One:🔽Blessed One, how should one view the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di'ang bas pa'i mthar phyin pa ma lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di'ang bas pa'i mthar phyin pa ma lags so //
translated: The Tathāgata’s teaching is not yet complete.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba'i slad du de'i rgyu dang rkyen bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba'i slad du de'i rgyu dang rkyen bstan du gsol //
translated: Blessed One, out of compassion, please explain the causes and conditions for this.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dper na / khyim bdag gi bu dag slob dpon la slob pa'i tshe na slob dpon gyi dbang du gyur pa ma lags sam /🔽gal te slob @253b dpon gyi dbang du gyur na'ang slob pa'i don mi 'grub la //
analyzed: dper na / khyim bdag gi bu dag slob dpon la slob pa'i tshe na slob dpon gyi dbang du gyur pa ma lags sam / gal te slob @253b dpon gyi dbang du gyur na'ang slob pa'i don mi 'grub la //
translated: For example, when the sons of a householder are studying, are they not under the control of their teacher?🔽If they are under the control of their teacher, they will not accomplish their studies.

original: slob dpon gyi dbang du ma gyur na'ang mi 'grub /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dbang du ma gyur na'ang mi 'grub /
translated: If they are not under the control of their teacher, they will not accomplish their studies.

original: bdag gis dbang du gyur na'ang slob pa'ang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag gis dbang du gyur na'ang slob pa'ang mi 'grub ste /
translated: If they are under their own control, they will not accomplish their studies.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata’s teaching is incomplete.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: it is also like this:

original: dper na / rgyal bcu ci'ang mi slob /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal bcu ci'ang mi slob /
translated: For example, there are ten types of kings who do not study anything

original: ci'ang mi shes pa dag bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ba lags mod kyi /
analyzed: ci'ang mi shes pa dag bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ba lags mod kyi /
translated: and do not know anything, and they are indeed under their own control.

original: glen zhing mi shes pas rtag tu sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: glen zhing mi shes pas rtag tu sdug bsngal lo //
translated: They are ignorant and foolish, and so they are always suffering.

original: de ltar na rgyal bu de ni bdag gi dbang du 'gyur zhes bgyir yang grub pa'i don ma mchis la /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal bu de ni bdag gi dbang du 'gyur zhes bgyir yang grub pa'i don ma mchis la /
translated: “In this way, the prince will come under my control.” But this is not a matter of accomplishment.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur zhes bgyir yang grub pa'i don ma mchis pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur zhes bgyir yang grub pa'i don ma mchis pas /
translated: “He will come under the control of others.” But this is not a matter of accomplishment.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'di ni lhag ma dang bcas pa lags pas /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'di ni lhag ma dang bcas pa lags pas /
translated: “Therefore, Blessed One, the meaning of what you have said is incomplete.

original: de bas na thams cad gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba la'ang nges par sdug bsngal zhes bgyir mi rung la /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba la'ang nges par sdug bsngal zhes bgyir mi rung la /
translated: “Therefore, it is not right to say that everything that comes under the control of others is necessarily suffering.

original: thams cad bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ba la'ang nges par bde ba zhes bgyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: thams cad bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ba la'ang nges par bde ba zhes bgyir mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not right to say that everything that comes under one’s own control is necessarily happiness.

original: nga rgyal gyis dregs pa thams cad kyang khro gtum can no zhes bgyi ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis dregs pa thams cad kyang khro gtum can no zhes bgyi ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
translated: “All those who are arrogant are also wrathful.” This is incomplete.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dper na / bud med chu gang can dag nga rgyal gyi dbang gis rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: dper na / bud med chu gang can dag nga rgyal gyi dbang gis rab tu byung ste /
translated: for example, there are women who are conceited and who go forth.

original: slob pa la zhugs na tshul khrims yongs su srung zhing spyod lam shin tu sdom ste /
analyzed: slob pa la zhugs na tshul khrims yongs su srung zhing spyod lam shin tu sdom ste /
translated: If one is engaged in training, one will completely protect morality and be very restrained in one’s behavior.

original: dbang po mi g-yeng bar nan tan byed do //
analyzed: dbang po mi g-yeng bar nan tan byed do //
translated: One will be careful not to let one’s senses be distracted.

original: de bas na nga @254a *//
analyzed: de bas na nga @254a *//
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad nges par khro gtum pa'o zhes bgyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad nges par khro gtum pa'o zhes bgyir mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not right to say that all afflictions are definitely wrathful.

original: des shing dge ba thams cad kyang byams pa dang snying rjer ldan no zhes bgyi ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
analyzed: des shing dge ba thams cad kyang byams pa dang snying rjer ldan no zhes bgyi ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: It is also incomplete to say that all gentleness and virtue are associated with love and compassion.

original: dper na / mi zhig phas pham pa zhig byung yang chos gos ma spangs /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig phas pham pa zhig byung yang chos gos ma spangs /
translated: For example, a man may commit a defeating offense but not abandon his Dharma robes.

original: phyi rol gyi spyod lam shin tu sdom yang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi spyod lam shin tu sdom yang /
translated: He may be very restrained in his external behavior,

original: chos srung ba dag mthong na mi 'dod de spong ngo //
analyzed: chos srung ba dag mthong na mi 'dod de spong ngo //
translated: but when he sees those who uphold the Dharma, he does not want to see them and avoids them.

original: de tshe 'phos nas kyang sems can dmyal bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: de tshe 'phos nas kyang sems can dmyal bar ltung ngo //
translated: When he dies, he will fall into the hells.

original: gal te dge slong zhig phas pham pa byung na chos srung ba de dag gis skrod par byed de khyim par 'bebs so //
analyzed: gal te dge slong zhig phas pham pa byung na chos srung ba de dag gis skrod par byed de khyim par 'bebs so //
translated: If a monk commits a defeating offense, those who uphold the Dharma will expel him and make him return to lay life.

original: de bas na des shing dge ba thams cad la nges par byams pa dang ldan no zhes bgyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na des shing dge ba thams cad la nges par byams pa dang ldan no zhes bgyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to say that he is loving and kind to all who are virtuous.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the World-Honored One said to Manjushri:

original: rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar lhag ma dang bcas pa'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar lhag ma dang bcas pa'i don gsungs so //
translated: “Because there are causes and conditions, the Tathagata has said that there is a remainder.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das ni rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir 'di skad ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das ni rgyu dang rkyen yod pa'i phyir 'di skad ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Again, because there are causes and conditions, the World-Honored One has said this.

original: rgyal po'i khab 'dir bud med shin tu bzang mo zhes bya ba zhig pha ma'i khyim du 'gro ba'i lam yongs su nga gang na bar 'ongs nas /🔽sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab 'dir bud med shin tu bzang mo zhes bya ba zhig pha ma'i khyim du 'gro ba'i lam yongs su nga gang na bar 'ongs nas / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun /
translated: In this city of Rajagrha there was a very beautiful woman who went to her parents’ home. On the way she met me.🔽She took refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha.

original: skyabs su gsol nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: skyabs su gsol nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then she said:

original: bud med thams cad ni mthu med pa /
analyzed: bud med thams cad ni mthu med pa /
translated: ‘All women are powerless.

original: dbang med pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang med pa yin no //
translated: They are not free.

original: skyes pa thams cad ni @254b dbang la thogs pa med pa yin no zhes smras pas /
analyzed: skyes pa thams cad ni @254b dbang la thogs pa med pa yin no zhes smras pas /
translated: All men are powerful and have no obstacles.’

original: de'i tshe na bud med de'i bsam pa thugs su chud nas de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bud med de'i bsam pa thugs su chud nas de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras pa yin no //
translated: At that time, understanding the woman's thoughts, he spoke these verses.

original: 'jam dpal / legs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / legs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, excellent!

original: legs so // khyod kyis sems can thams cad kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la de lta bu'i don dri ba legs so //
analyzed: legs so // khyod kyis sems can thams cad kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la de lta bu'i don dri ba legs so //
translated: Excellent! For the sake of all sentient beings, you have asked the Tathāgata about such a matter.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gyis tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gyis tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī spoke in verse:

original: sems can skye dgu thams cad ni //
analyzed: sems can skye dgu thams cad ni //
translated: All sentient beings

original: kun kyang zas dang skom la brten //
analyzed: kun kyang zas dang skom la brten //
translated: All depend on food and drink.

original: mthu dang ldan pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa thams cad ni //
translated: All who are powerful

original: de yi sems la phrag dog med //
analyzed: de yi sems la phrag dog med //
translated: Have no envy in their minds.

original: thams cad zas dang skom gyi rkyen //
analyzed: thams cad zas dang skom gyi rkyen //
translated: All are conditioned by food and drink

original: nad kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nad kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur //
translated: And experience the suffering of illness.

original: spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni //
translated: Pure conduct

original: rab tu bde ba myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rab tu bde ba myong bar 'gyur //
translated: Will experience true happiness.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das tsunda'i bsod snyoms dang mchod pa bzhes pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyengs pa mi mnga'am /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das tsunda'i bsod snyoms dang mchod pa bzhes pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyengs pa mi mnga'am /
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, will the Tathāgata accept Cundā's alms and offerings without fear?

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One then spoke in verse to Mañjuśrī:

original: sems can skye dgu thams cad ni //
analyzed: sems can skye dgu thams cad ni //
translated: All sentient beings

original: zas dang skom la ltos ma yin //
analyzed: zas dang skom la ltos ma yin //
translated: are not dependent on food and drink.

original: mthu dang ldan pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa thams cad kyang /
translated: All those with power

original: phrag dog sems ni med ma yin //
analyzed: phrag dog sems ni med ma yin //
translated: are not without an envious mind.

original: thams cad zas kyi rkyen dbang gis //
analyzed: thams cad zas kyi rkyen dbang gis //
translated: All are not controlled by the condition of food,

original: nad kyis gzir bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: nad kyis gzir bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: and do not become afflicted by illness.

original: spyod pa dag pa thams cad kyang //
analyzed: spyod pa dag pa thams cad kyang //
translated: All those with pure conduct

original: thams cad bde ba myong ma yin //
analyzed: thams cad bde ba myong ma yin //
translated: are not all experiencing happiness.

original: 'jam dpal ci ste khyod na bar gyur na de bzhin du nga'ang na bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci ste khyod na bar gyur na de bzhin du nga'ang na bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, if you were to become ill, it would be reasonable that I too would become ill.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas @255a *//
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas @255a *//
translated: Arhats, pratyekabuddhas,

original: rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par na ci'ang za ba med de /
analyzed: rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag par na ci'ang za ba med de /
translated: bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas do not truly eat anything.

original: pha rol 'dul ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo tshad med pa dag gi sbyin pa blangs par bstan te /
analyzed: pha rol 'dul ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo tshad med pa dag gi sbyin pa blangs par bstan te /
translated: In order to tame others, they demonstrate accepting the offerings of countless ordinary beings.

original: de'ang de dag gi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten las bsgral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'ang de dag gi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten las bsgral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, they are to perfect the perfection of generosity and to liberate beings from the hells, animal wombs, and the world of Yama.

original: de la gang zhig 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang lo drug gi bar du shin tu spyod dka' ba spyad de /
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang lo drug gi bar du shin tu spyod dka' ba spyad de /
translated: If someone thinks that the Tathāgata practiced austerities for six years and

original: sku'ang shin tu nyam chung bar gyur to snyam du sems na de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: sku'ang shin tu nyam chung bar gyur to snyam du sems na de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: that his body became very weak, that is not the case.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni srid pa las rnam par grol bas bus pa ma rabs dang mi 'dra ba yin na ci'i phyir sku nyam chung zhing ring bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni srid pa las rnam par grol bas bus pa ma rabs dang mi 'dra ba yin na ci'i phyir sku nyam chung zhing ring bar 'gyur /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, being liberated from existence, is not like an ordinary person. Why would his body become weak and emaciated?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni shin tu brtson 'grus su nan tan byas pas rdo rje lta bu'i sku thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni shin tu brtson 'grus su nan tan byas pas rdo rje lta bu'i sku thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, through practicing with great diligence, attained a vajra-like body.

original: 'jig rten dang bcas pa'i lus skyon yod pa lta bu dang 'dra ba ma yin ste de'i nye gnas rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar bsam gyis mi khyab pas zas la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bcas pa'i lus skyon yod pa lta bu dang 'dra ba ma yin ste de'i nye gnas rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar bsam gyis mi khyab pas zas la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: The gods are not dependent on food.

original: mthu bo che thams cad phrag dog med do //
analyzed: mthu bo che thams cad phrag dog med do //
translated: The gods are not jealous.

original: zhes bya ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
translated: This is also incomplete.

original: dper na / 'jig rten na mi kha cig tshe gcig tu phrag dog gi sems kyang med la mthu med pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten na mi kha cig tshe gcig tu phrag dog gi sems kyang med la mthu med pa'ang yod do //
translated: In the world, there are some people who, in the course of a single existence, are without jealousy and without power.🔽All sickness has food as its cause.

original: nad thams cad zas la 'gyur @255b zhes bya ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
analyzed: nad thams cad zas la 'gyur @255b zhes bya ba'ang lhag ma dang bcas so //
