analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci'i slad du cang mi gsung bar gzims te nyan thos kyi nye gnas rnams la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par grol ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / yang dag par spong ba la brtson pa dag ci'i slad du mi ston /
translated: Why, Tathāgata, do you lie there in silence without teaching the disciples who are striving in the perfection of moral discipline, concentration, liberation, meditative absorption, and perfect abandonment?

original: ci'i rkyen gyis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde shin tu zab mo 'di dag mi gsung zhing ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas tshad med pa'i thabs kyis 'od srung chen po mi'i nang na glang po'i rgyal po dang 'dra ba dang / skyes bu chen po rnams la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa mi ston /
analyzed: ci'i rkyen gyis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde shin tu zab mo 'di dag mi gsung zhing ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas tshad med pa'i thabs kyis 'od srung chen po mi'i nang na glang po'i rgyal po dang 'dra ba dang / skyes bu chen po rnams la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa mi ston /
translated: Why do you not teach these extremely profound Mahāyāna sūtras? Why does the Tathāgata not teach with immeasurable skillful means that Mahākāśyapa, who is like an elephant king among men, and the great beings will not turn away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: ci'i slad du dge slong ma rungs pa ma brtags pa'i @258b dngos po thams cad 'chang ba la chad pas gcod pa mi ston /
analyzed: ci'i slad du dge slong ma rungs pa ma brtags pa'i @258b dngos po thams cad 'chang ba la chad pas gcod pa mi ston /
translated: Why do you not teach the punishment of bad monks who keep all kinds of things that should not be kept?

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par snyun mi mnga' bzhin du ci'i slad du cang mi gsung bar glo g-yas pa phab nas gzims par gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par snyun mi mnga' bzhin du ci'i slad du cang mi gsung bar glo g-yas pa phab nas gzims par gyur /
translated: Why, Blessed One, when you are not really sick, do you lie down on your right side without saying anything?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag nad pa la nad kyi rkyen sman byin pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag nad pa la nad kyi rkyen sman byin pa na /
translated: When bodhisattvas give medicine to the sick,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sems can la bdar nas thun mong du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bsngos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sems can la bdar nas thun mong du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bsngos te /
translated: they dedicate all their roots of virtue to sentient beings, sharing them equally and dedicating them to omniscient wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / las kyis sgrib pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yongs su sel to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / las kyis sgrib pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yongs su sel to //
translated: They clear away the afflictive obscurations, the karmic obscurations, and the obscurations of ripening of all sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bgyi ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / mi 'dzem pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bgyi ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / mi 'dzem pa dang /
translated: aversion, ignorance, and anger, as well as envy, stinginess, deceit, fraud, shamelessness,

original: khrel med pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rab kyi nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal dang / bag med pa dang /
analyzed: khrel med pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rab kyi nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal dang / bag med pa dang /
translated: lack of embarrassment, pride, great pride, higher pride, pride, false pride, manifest pride, lesser pride, carelessness,

original: dregs pa dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / rtsod pa dang / log par 'tsho ba dang / g-yo sgyus tshul 'chos pa dang / rnyed pas rnyed pa tshol ba dang / chos ma yin pas tshol ba dang / mang du tshol ba dang /
analyzed: dregs pa dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / rtsod pa dang / log par 'tsho ba dang / g-yo sgyus tshul 'chos pa dang / rnyed pas rnyed pa tshol ba dang / chos ma yin pas tshol ba dang / mang du tshol ba dang /
translated: arrogance, resentment, quarreling, wrong livelihood, hypocrisy, seeking gain through gain, seeking through non-Dharma, and seeking much.

original: bsti stang med pa dang / bstan pa bzhin du mi byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / rnyed pa la chags pas mi skyo ba dang / 'ching @259a *//
analyzed: bsti stang med pa dang / bstan pa bzhin du mi byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / rnyed pa la chags pas mi skyo ba dang / 'ching @259a *//
translated: lack of respect, not acting in accordance with the teachings, relying on non-virtuous friends, not being discouraged by attachment to gain,

original: bas rnam par bcings bas dgrol bar dka' ba dang / 'dod pa ngan pa la 'dod pa dang / chags pa ngan pa la chags pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba dang / smyang zhing 'phras pa dang /
analyzed: bas rnam par bcings bas dgrol bar dka' ba dang / 'dod pa ngan pa la 'dod pa dang / chags pa ngan pa la chags pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba dang / smyang zhing 'phras pa dang /
translated: being difficult to liberate due to being bound by fetters, desiring bad desires, being attached to bad attachments, the view of the transitory collection, the view of existence, the view of non-existence, agitation and distraction,

original: dga' ba dang / gnyid dang / sprul pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba la chags pa dang / sems rmugs pa dang / sems gzhan la dmigs pa dang / mi dge ba yid la byed pa dang / lus dang ngag ngan par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / gnyid dang / sprul pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba la chags pa dang / sems rmugs pa dang / sems gzhan la dmigs pa dang / mi dge ba yid la byed pa dang / lus dang ngag ngan par spyod pa dang /
translated: delight, sleep, emanation, dislike, attachment to food and drink, mental dullness, focusing the mind on other things, unvirtuous mental activity, and engaging in bad physical and verbal conduct.

original: mang du smra ba la dga' ba dang / dbang po rnams rtul ba dang / smra'o cog tu rdzun zer ba dang / 'dod pa'i rtog pa dang / zhe sdang gi rtog pa dang / gnod pa'i rtog pas kun tu khebs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: mang du smra ba la dga' ba dang / dbang po rnams rtul ba dang / smra'o cog tu rdzun zer ba dang / 'dod pa'i rtog pa dang / zhe sdang gi rtog pa dang / gnod pa'i rtog pas kun tu khebs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: They are fond of talking a lot, their faculties are dull, they lie, they are overcome by thoughts of desire, thoughts of anger, and thoughts of harm, and they are covered by the obscurations of afflictions.

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba'i las kyi sgrib pa dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags su skye ba dang / dam pa'i chos la skur pa dang / log sreg can du skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zhes bgyi ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba'i las kyi sgrib pa dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags su skye ba dang / dam pa'i chos la skur pa dang / log sreg can du skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zhes bgyi ste /
translated: They are the obscurations of the five heinous actions, the obscurations of the ripening of the karma of being born as a hell being, an animal, or a hungry ghost, the obscurations of slandering the sublime Dharma, and the obscurations of being born in a place where there is no opportunity to practice.🔽“These three obscurations are called great illnesses. When bodhisattvas practice bodhisattva conduct for immeasurable eons, they give the gift of medicine to all the sick and make this aspiration:

original: sgrib pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni nad chen po zhes bgyi na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa na na ba thams cad la sman gsos kyi sbyin pa byin te 'di skad du smon🔽lam btab bo //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni nad chen po zhes bgyi na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa na na ba thams cad la sman gsos kyi sbyin pa byin te 'di skad du smon🔽lam btab bo //
translated: ‘May all sentient beings be free from illness.

original: sems can thams cad nad dang yongs su bral te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nad dang yongs su bral te /
translated: May all sentient beings be free from illness.

original: de bzhin gshegs @259b pa'i rdo rje'i sku thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @259b pa'i rdo rje'i sku thob par gyur cig /
translated: May they attain the vajra body of the Thus-Gone One.

original: sems can tshad med pa thams cad la sman dam pa'i rgyal por gyur te /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa thams cad la sman dam pa'i rgyal por gyur te /
translated: May they become the king of supreme medicines for all immeasurable sentient beings.

original: nad ma rungs pa thams cad sel bar gyur cig /
analyzed: nad ma rungs pa thams cad sel bar gyur cig /
translated: May they eliminate all harmful illnesses.

original: sems can thams cad sman aa ka rte thob cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sman aa ka rte thob cing /
translated: May all sentient beings obtain the medicine akarta.

original: sman de'i mthus gdug pa thams cad sel bar gyur cig /
analyzed: sman de'i mthus gdug pa thams cad sel bar gyur cig /
translated: By the power of that medicine, may they eliminate all poisons.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog cing /
translated: Moreover, may all sentient beings never turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: myur du bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sman rnyed de /
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sman rnyed de /
translated: May they quickly find the unsurpassed medicine of buddhahood.

original: nyon mongs pa'i zug rngu thams cad sel bar gyur cig /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i zug rngu thams cad sel bar gyur cig /
translated: May they eliminate all the pains of afflictions.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad shin tu brtson 'grus brtsom pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i thugs dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad shin tu brtson 'grus brtsom pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i thugs dang ldan te /
translated: Moreover, may all sentient beings, through their great diligence, attain the vajra-like mind of the Thus-Gone One.

original: sman dam par gyur nas nad thams cad gso shing rtsod pa'i 'du shes med par gyur cig /
analyzed: sman dam par gyur nas nad thams cad gso shing rtsod pa'i 'du shes med par gyur cig /
translated: May they become the best of medicines, curing all illnesses, and may they be free of the notion of conflict.

original: gzhan yang sems can dag sman gyi sdong po chen por gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can dag sman gyi sdong po chen por gyur te /
translated: Moreover, may all sentient beings become great medicinal trees,

original: nad ma rungs pa thams cad bsal bar gyur cig /
analyzed: nad ma rungs pa thams cad bsal bar gyur cig /
translated: removing all manner of pernicious illnesses.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad gdug pa'i zug rngu phyung nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i 'od zer thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad gdug pa'i zug rngu phyung nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i 'od zer thob par gyur cig /
translated: Moreover, may all sentient beings remove the pain of all poisons and attain the unsurpassed light rays of the Thus-Gone One.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sman chen po'i chos kyi gter shin tu zab mo la 'jug par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sman chen po'i chos kyi gter shin tu zab mo la 'jug par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs so //
translated: Moreover, may all sentient beings enter the profound Dharma treasure of the Thus-Gone One’s great medicine of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang de ltar bskal pa tshad med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang de ltar bskal pa tshad med /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattvas make aspirations for incalculable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: inconceivable,

original: bgrang du med pa brgya stong gi bar du de skad @260a *//
analyzed: bgrang du med pa brgya stong gi bar du de skad @260a *//
translated: and innumerable hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: ces smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: ces smon lam btab ste /
translated: Having made these aspirations,

original: sems can thams cad nad ma mchis par bgyid na ci'i rkyen gyis de bzhin gshegs pa nga na 'o zhes bka' stsal /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nad ma mchis par bgyid na ci'i rkyen gyis de bzhin gshegs pa nga na 'o zhes bka' stsal /
translated: If you can make all sentient beings free from illness, why is it that the Tathāgata is ill?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na nad pa kha cig ni 'dug pa dang / ldang ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'gog kyang mi nus /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na nad pa kha cig ni 'dug pa dang / ldang ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'gog kyang mi nus /
translated: further, in the world, some sick people are unable to sit, stand, walk, or stop.

original: kha zas dang / skom yang mi chud de /
analyzed: kha zas dang / skom yang mi chud de /
translated: They cannot digest food or drink.

original: bu tsha la ston cing 'chos kyang mi nus /
analyzed: bu tsha la ston cing 'chos kyang mi nus /
translated: They are unable to teach and instruct their children.

original: 'tsho nam gyi las bya ba'i 'doms kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: 'tsho nam gyi las bya ba'i 'doms kyang mi nus te /
translated: They are unable to give advice on how to make a living.

original: de'i tshe na de'i pha ma dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / 'khor dang / gnyen bshes la sogs pa thams cad kyis de ni nges par 'chi bar 'du shes so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de'i pha ma dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / 'khor dang / gnyen bshes la sogs pa thams cad kyis de ni nges par 'chi bar 'du shes so //
translated: At that time, all their parents, wives, children, retinue, relatives, and so forth think that they will certainly die.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: the Tathāgata is also like that.

original: glo g-yas pa phab nas gzims te /
analyzed: glo g-yas pa phab nas gzims te /
translated: He lies down on his right side,

original: cang mi gsung bar gyur pas dzambu'i gling 'di na skye bo blun po dag 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cang mi gsung bar gyur pas dzambu'i gling 'di na skye bo blun po dag 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the Tathāgata does not respond, the foolish in this world will think,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nges par mya ngan las 'das te 'gog pa zad pa'i 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nges par mya ngan las 'das te 'gog pa zad pa'i 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: ‘The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One has definitely entered nirvāṇa. They will develop the perception of cessation and extinction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'ang ma mchis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'ang ma mchis so //
translated: The Tathāgata himself does not ultimately enter nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathāgata is permanent, unchanging, and does not pass away.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nga 'di ltar rgyab na'o zhes gsungs pa'i mi rigs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das gzhan @260b yang 'jig rten na nad pa kha cig ni shin tu skem zhing rid pas gan rkyal lam /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nga 'di ltar rgyab na'o zhes gsungs pa'i mi rigs so // bcom ldan 'das gzhan @260b yang 'jig rten na nad pa kha cig ni shin tu skem zhing rid pas gan rkyal lam /
translated: For that reason and those conditions, I say this is not appropriate.

original: glos nyal nas ldang mi nus te /
analyzed: glos nyal nas ldang mi nus te /
translated: Blessed One, moreover, in the world there are some sick people who are very emaciated and thin, lying on their backs or on their sides, unable to get up.

original: de'i tshe 'khor rnams kyang de la mi 'dod pa'i sems skyes nas gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'du shes so //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor rnams kyang de la mi 'dod pa'i sems skyes nas gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'du shes so //
translated: At that time, the retinue also gave rise to a mind of non-appreciation and the idea that he would certainly die.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like that.

original: mu stegs can rnam pa dgu bcu rtsa lnga po mi 'dod de mya ngan las 'da' bar 'du shes so //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnam pa dgu bcu rtsa lnga po mi 'dod de mya ngan las 'da' bar 'du shes so //
translated: The ninety-five non-Buddhist tīrthikas do not appreciate it and have the idea that he will pass into nirvāṇa.

original: mu stegs can dag 'di skad du bdag cag la sogs pa ni bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag po dang / dus dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i chos kyis rtag par gyur pas 'gyur zhing 'pho ba med kyi /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag 'di skad du bdag cag la sogs pa ni bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag po dang / dus dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i chos kyis rtag par gyur pas 'gyur zhing 'pho ba med kyi /
translated: The tīrthikas say, “We and so forth are called ‘self,’ and by the dharmas of self, master, time, subtle particle, and so forth, we are permanent, unchanging, and do not move.

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma ni mi rtag pas phrogs nas 'gyur zhing 'pho ba'i chos can du gyur to zhes smra'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma ni mi rtag pas phrogs nas 'gyur zhing 'pho ba'i chos can du gyur to zhes smra'o //
translated: The ascetic Gautama is impermanent and is carried away by change and has the quality of movement.”

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar glo g-yas pa phab ste gzims pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar glo g-yas pa phab ste gzims pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not right for the Bhagavān to lie down on his right side without saying anything.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na nad pa dag ni chen po bzhi nyams nas shas mi mnyam pa la shin tu rid cing skem par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na nad pa dag ni chen po bzhi nyams nas shas mi mnyam pa la shin tu rid cing skem par gyur te /
translated: Moreover, in the world, when the four great elements are impaired, the humors become unbalanced, and one becomes extremely emaciated and thin.

original: de bas na yid bzhin du ldang ba dang / 'dug pa mi nus te nyal ba lags na /
analyzed: de bas na yid bzhin du ldang ba dang / 'dug pa mi nus te nyal ba lags na /
translated: Therefore, one is unable to rise or sit as one wishes, but must lie down.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chen po bzhi yang mi mnyam pa ma mchis la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chen po bzhi yang mi mnyam pa ma mchis la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One, however, has no imbalance in the four great elements.

original: sku'i mthu dang yang ldan /
analyzed: sku'i mthu dang yang ldan /
translated: He possesses the power of the body.

original: nyams rid pa'ang ma mchis te /
analyzed: nyams rid pa'ang ma mchis te /
translated: He is not emaciated.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: khyu mchog chung ngu bcu'i stobs ni khyu mchog chen po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: khyu mchog chung ngu bcu'i stobs ni khyu mchog chen po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: the strength of ten small bulls is not equal to the strength of one large bull.

original: khyu mchog chen po bcu'i stobs kyang khyu mchog chen po sngon po gcig gi stobs su ma @261a *//🔽mchis / khyu mchog sngon po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang g-yung gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: khyu mchog chen po bcu'i stobs kyang khyu mchog chen po sngon po gcig gi stobs su ma @261a *// mchis / khyu mchog sngon po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang g-yung gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten large bulls is not equal to the strength of one blue bull.🔽The strength of ten blue bulls is not equal to the strength of one wild bull.

original: bal glang g-yung bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang rgod gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang g-yung bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang rgod gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten wild bulls is not equal to the strength of one rutting bull.

original: bal glang rgod bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang mche ba gnyis pa gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang rgod bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang mche ba gnyis pa gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten wild elephants is not the same as the strength of one two-tusked elephant.

original: bal glang mche ba gnyis pa bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang mche ba bzhi pa gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang mche ba gnyis pa bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang mche ba bzhi pa gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten two-tusked elephants is not the same as the strength of one four-tusked elephant.

original: bal glang mche ba bzhi pa bcu'i stobs kyang gangs kyi ri'i bal glang dkar po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /🔽gangs kyi ri'i bal glang dkar po bcu'i stobs kyang spos kyi bal glang gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /🔽spos kyi bal glang bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang sngon po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang mche ba bzhi pa bcu'i stobs kyang gangs kyi ri'i bal glang dkar po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis / gangs kyi ri'i bal glang dkar po bcu'i stobs kyang spos kyi bal glang gcig gi stobs su ma mchis / spos kyi bal glang bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang sngon po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten four-tusked elephants is not the same as the strength of one white snow mountain elephant.🔽The strength of ten white snow mountain elephants is not the same as the strength of one incense elephant.🔽The strength of ten incense elephants is not the same as the strength of one blue elephant.

original: bal glang sngon po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang ser po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang sngon po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang ser po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten blue elephants is not the same as the strength of one yellow elephant.

original: bal glang ser po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang dmar po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang ser po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang dmar po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten yellow elephants is not the same as the strength of one red elephant.

original: bal glang dmar po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang dkar po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang dmar po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang dkar po gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten red elephants is not the strength of one white elephant.

original: bal glang dkar po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang ri zhes bya ba gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang dkar po bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang ri zhes bya ba gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten white elephants is not the strength of one elephant called a mountain.

original: bal glang ri zhes bya ba bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang autpa la gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /🔽bal glang autpa la bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang ku mu da gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang ri zhes bya ba bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang autpa la gcig gi stobs su ma mchis / bal glang autpa la bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang ku mu da gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten mountain elephants is not the strength of one elephant called an utpala.🔽The strength of ten utpala elephants is not the strength of one elephant called a kumuta.

original: bal glang @261b ku mud bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang punda ri ka gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang @261b ku mud bcu'i stobs kyang bal glang punda ri ka gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten kumuta elephants is not the strength of one elephant called a pundarika.

original: bal glang punda ri ka bcu'i stobs kyang mi'i nang na gyad gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: bal glang punda ri ka bcu'i stobs kyang mi'i nang na gyad gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten pundarika elephants is not the strength of one human wrestler.

original: mi'i gyad bcu'i stobs kyang pa ra gan de gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: mi'i gyad bcu'i stobs kyang pa ra gan de gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten human wrestlers is not the strength of one pariganda.

original: pa ra gan de bcu'i stobs kyang mthu bo che lag pa brgyad pa gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
analyzed: pa ra gan de bcu'i stobs kyang mthu bo che lag pa brgyad pa gcig gi stobs su ma mchis /
translated: The strength of ten parigandas is not the strength of one mighty man with eight arms.

original: mthu bo che bcu'i stobs kyang gnas bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshigs gcig pa'i stobs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: mthu bo che bcu'i stobs kyang gnas bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshigs gcig pa'i stobs su ma mchis so //
translated: The strength of the ten great powerful men is not equal to one-sixteenth of the strength of a bodhisattva in the tenth stage.

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi rus pa'i tshigs ni gcig la gcig reg cing 'brel ba ma lags kyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi rus pa'i tshigs ni gcig la gcig reg cing 'brel ba ma lags kyi /
translated: The joints of the bones of all ordinary people are not connected to each other.

original: gyad stobs po che'i rus pa'i tshigs ni gcig la gcig reg go /
analyzed: gyad stobs po che'i rus pa'i tshigs ni gcig la gcig reg go /
translated: The joints of the bones of a great powerful wrestler are connected to each other.

original: pa ra gan de'i rus pa'i tshigs ni gcig la gcig 'brel to //
analyzed: pa ra gan de'i rus pa'i tshigs ni gcig la gcig 'brel to //
translated: The joints of the bones of a paragantha are connected to each other.

original: mthu po che'i rus pa'i tshigs ni lu gu rgyud bzhin gcig la gcig 'brel to //
analyzed: mthu po che'i rus pa'i tshigs ni lu gu rgyud bzhin gcig la gcig 'brel to //
translated: The joints of the bones of a mahouts are connected to each other like a chain.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rus pa'i tshigs ni 'brug 'khyil ba ltar mdud pa can du mchis pas de bas na de'i stobs ni mchog tu che'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rus pa'i tshigs ni 'brug 'khyil ba ltar mdud pa can du mchis pas de bas na de'i stobs ni mchog tu che'o //
translated: The joints of the bones of a bodhisattva are like coiled dragons, with knots. Therefore, his strength is supremely great.

original: 'jig rten thog ma mngon par chags pa na rdo rje'i mtha' la brten te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thog ma mngon par chags pa na rdo rje'i mtha' la brten te /
translated: When the world first formed, it was based on the edge of a vajra.

original: rdo rje'i gdan snying po byang chub kyi dkyil 'khor du mngon par byung nas byang chub sems dpa' gdan de la bzhugs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan snying po byang chub kyi dkyil 'khor du mngon par byung nas byang chub sems dpa' gdan de la bzhugs te /
translated: He appeared in the Bodhimanda of Vajrasana and sat there as a Bodhisattva.

original: de nyid kyi tshe na stobs bcu rnyed par gyur to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe na stobs bcu rnyed par gyur to //
translated: At that time, he attained the ten powers.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byis pa chung ngu lta bu ma lags te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byis pa chung ngu lta bu ma lags te /
translated: The Tathagata is not like a small child.

original: byis pa chung ngu ni glan te shes pa ma mchis la /
analyzed: byis pa chung ngu ni glan te shes pa ma mchis la /
translated: A small child is unable to understand anything and

original: smra'ang mi shes pas na yid bzhin du 'gre zhing nyal yang @262a *//
analyzed: smra'ang mi shes pas na yid bzhin du 'gre zhing nyal yang @262a *//
translated: does not know how to speak. He can crawl and sleep as he pleases,

original: su'ang mi 'phya ste /
analyzed: su'ang mi 'phya ste /
translated: and no one will criticize him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes chen po dang ldan pas thams cad la 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad pa ni mi'i nang na klu lta bu lags pas gzi brjid chen po dang ldan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes chen po dang ldan pas thams cad la 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad pa ni mi'i nang na klu lta bu lags pas gzi brjid chen po dang ldan te /
translated: The Tathagata possesses great wisdom and illuminates everything with his light. He is like a naga among humans and possesses great majesty.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po mngon par rdzogs nas bla na med pa'i drang srong chen po the tshom gyi dra pa yongs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po mngon par rdzogs nas bla na med pa'i drang srong chen po the tshom gyi dra pa yongs su bcad pa /
translated: He has fully accomplished great miracles and is the unsurpassed great Rishi who has cut through the net of doubts.

original: 'dod pa'i zug rngu phyung ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zug rngu phyung ba /
translated: He has extracted the arrow of desire.

original: spyod lam shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: spyod lam shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: His deportment is extremely beautiful.

original: spyod lam gyi dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: spyod lam gyi dbang du gyur pa /
translated: “You are not subject to the power of conduct.

original: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba lags na ci'i slad du glo g-yas pa phab ste gzims pas 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang mi thams cad mi dga' zhing sdug bsngal gyis gdungs par mdzad /
analyzed: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba lags na ci'i slad du glo g-yas pa phab ste gzims pas 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang mi thams cad mi dga' zhing sdug bsngal gyis gdungs par mdzad /
translated: You are not afraid. Why then do you lie down on your right side and thus cause all the gods and humans in the world to be unhappy and tormented by suffering?”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa spoke in verse in the presence of the Bhagavān:

original: yon tan chen po goo ta ma //
analyzed: yon tan chen po goo ta ma //
translated: “Gautama of great qualities,

original: bzhengs te dam chos bstan du gsol //🔽ji ltar byis pa chung ngu'am //
analyzed: bzhengs te dam chos bstan du gsol // ji ltar byis pa chung ngu'am //
translated: Please rise and teach the sublime Dharma.🔽Do not be like a small child

original: nad pa nyal ba lta bu min //
analyzed: nad pa nyal ba lta bu min //
translated: Or a sick person lying down.

original: lha mi ston pa kha lo sgyur //
analyzed: lha mi ston pa kha lo sgyur //
translated: Teacher of gods and humans, charioteer,🔽When you lie down at the foot of the lord of trees,

original: shing dbang drung du gzims pa 'di; ;byis pa ma rabs mthong nas su //
analyzed: shing dbang drung du gzims pa 'di; ;byis pa ma rabs mthong nas su //
translated: Seeing childish fools,

original: nges par mya ngan 'da' zhes mchi //
analyzed: nges par mya ngan 'da' zhes mchi //
translated: You will certainly attain nirvāṇa.”

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde las //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde las //
translated: From the extensive sūtras,

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul zab mo yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul zab mo yi //
translated: The profound domain of the buddhas,

original: dgongs te gsungs ba mi shes pa //
analyzed: dgongs te gsungs ba mi shes pa //
translated: Not knowing the intentional teachings,

original: dmus long lam mi mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: dmus long lam mi mthong ba bzhin //
translated: Like the blind not seeing the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang // 'jam dpal gzhon nu la sogs pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang // 'jam dpal gzhon nu la sogs pa //
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, and so forth,

original: zab mo'i don rnams rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: zab mo'i don rnams rtogs pa ni //
translated: Have realized the profound meaning,

original: ji ltar 'phong la goms @262b pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phong la goms @262b pa bzhin //
translated: Just as one becomes skilled in archery.

original: dus gsum gshegs pa'i bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: dus gsum gshegs pa'i bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The Bhagavān who has gone to the three times,

original: thugs rje chen po'i gtso bor gyur //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i gtso bor gyur //
translated: Has become the foremost of great compassion.

original: de ltar thugs rje che ba de //
analyzed: de ltar thugs rje che ba de //
translated: In that way, that great compassion,

original: da ltar ji ltar ga la mchis //
analyzed: da ltar ji ltar ga la mchis //
translated: How can it exist now?🔽If he does not have compassion,

original: ji ste thugs rje mi mnga' na; ;sangs rgyas zhes kyang bgyir mi rung //
analyzed: ji ste thugs rje mi mnga' na; ;sangs rgyas zhes kyang bgyir mi rung //
translated: He cannot be called a buddha.

original: ji ste mya ngan 'das gyur na //
analyzed: ji ste mya ngan 'das gyur na //
translated: If he has attained nirvāṇa,

original: rtag pa zhes kyang bgyir mi rung //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes kyang bgyir mi rung //
translated: He cannot be called permanent.

original: bla na med pa bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: bla na med pa bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The unsurpassed Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag gsol ba gnang bar mdzod //
analyzed: bdag cag gsol ba gnang bar mdzod //
translated: Please grant our request.

original: 'gro ba kun la bde ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la bde ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of the happiness of all beings,

original: mu stegs can dag gdul du gsol //
analyzed: mu stegs can dag gdul du gsol //
translated: Please tame the tīrthikas.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po la goms pa'i thugs kyis sems can so so'i bsam pa mkhyen nas de dag gi rjes su mthar phan pa dang bde ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir gzims pa las bzhengs nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po la goms pa'i thugs kyis sems can so so'i bsam pa mkhyen nas de dag gi rjes su mthar phan pa dang bde ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir gzims pa las bzhengs nas /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān, with a mind accustomed to great compassion, knowing the individual thoughts of sentient beings, arose from his bed in order to ultimately benefit and bring happiness to those beings.

original: skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs so //
translated: He sat cross-legged.

original: de'i tshe sku mdog lhang nge lham mer 'tsher ba ni gser btso ma ltar gsal bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe sku mdog lhang nge lham mer 'tsher ba ni gser btso ma ltar gsal bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, his radiant body was as clear as refined gold.

original: zhal mdog shin tu mdzes pa ni ji ltar zla ba rgyas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhal mdog shin tu mdzes pa ni ji ltar zla ba rgyas pa lta bu'o //
translated: His very beautiful face was like the full moon.

original: sku shin tu gsal zhing dag pas dri ma'am /
analyzed: sku shin tu gsal zhing dag pas dri ma'am /
translated: His very clear and pure body was without any

original: rnyog pa'i bag med de /
analyzed: rnyog pa'i bag med de /
translated: impurities or taints.

original: 'od zer chen po bkye nas nam mkha'i dbyings yongs su gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'od zer chen po bkye nas nam mkha'i dbyings yongs su gang bar gyur to //
translated: Emitting great light rays, he filled the realm of space.

original: nyi ma brgya stong pas shin tu lhag pa'i 'od kyis shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi dang / steng dang 'og gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can thams cad la ye shes chen po'i snang ba byin nas ma rig pa'i mun pa yongs su bsal to //🔽gzhan yang sems @263a *//
analyzed: nyi ma brgya stong pas shin tu lhag pa'i 'od kyis shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi dang / steng dang 'og gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can thams cad la ye shes chen po'i snang ba byin nas ma rig pa'i mun pa yongs su bsal to // gzhan yang sems @263a *//
translated: With a light that was a hundred thousand times brighter than the sun, he illuminated all the worlds in the ten directions, from the eastern direction to the southern, western, and northern directions, the four intermediate directions, the zenith, and the nadir. He illuminated all the worlds in the ten directions with the light of great wisdom, and he dispelled the darkness of ignorance.

original: can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong snyed byang chub kyi sems las slar mi ldog par bkod do //
analyzed: can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong snyed byang chub kyi sems las slar mi ldog par bkod do //
translated: He also established many quintillions of sentient beings in the mind of awakening, so that they would not turn back from perfect and complete unsurpassed awakening.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das seng ge'i rgyal po ltar bsnyengs pa med bzhin du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku yongs su brgyan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das seng ge'i rgyal po ltar bsnyengs pa med bzhin du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku yongs su brgyan te /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, like a lion king who is fearless, was adorned with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks of a great being.
